title: A Stylist Told Us the Shoes We Need to Seamlessly Transition from Winter to Spring — and What to ‘Avoid’
description: Fashion stylist Chelsea Volpe told PEOPLE all about the best shoes for seasonal transitions. Her top picks include structural boots, polished sneakers, and timeless loafers, as well as options from Veja and Alohas. Add them to your cart now from $19, and keep wearing them through spring
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Shop expert-vetted loafers, sneakers, boots, and more from $19
We’ve made it to February, and the arrival of spring is starting to feel within reach. If you’re hesitant to invest in winter-friendly pieces that will be tucked away once the season ends, it may be time to start looking for styles you can wear now and later.
One of the best places to start when curating a transitional wardrobe is with your shoe collection, and we tapped fashion stylist and creative director Chelsea Volpe for her top recommendations. The standout qualities she looks for in a shoe? “A strong silhouette, thoughtful proportions, and materials that feel elevated rather than trendy-for-trendy’s-sake,” she tells PEOPLE. Below, shop picks inspired by her recommendations from $19.
“If a shoe can move seamlessly from a coat-heavy February look into a light-layers April outfit, it’s earned its place,” Volpe adds. 
Volpe says that if she “had to recommend one [shoe] above the rest,” it would be the modern loafer. “It works with tailoring, denim, and dresses,” she explains, adding that it’s best to “avoid chunky lug soles or shiny patent” when going for a transitional look. Instead, reach for a pair like this one from Amazon, as it feels substantial while still looking “visually light.” 
No winter wardrobe is complete without a pair of booties. Volpe suggests opting for a “sleek ankle boot with a slim shaft and architectural heel,” as it “works under trousers now and with bare legs later.” This style includes one of her favorite silhouette details for seasonal transitions — an almond or soft square toe — and shoppers note that they feel comfortable, even after hours of wear. 
“Refined flats, loafers, and minimalist sneakers are truly seasonless,” Volpe shares, noting that a Veja sneaker, in particular, “can live year-round” because it doesn’t “rely on weather-specific styling cues.” Pick up this pair from the brand that Reese Witherspoon, Meghan Markle, and our editors turn to for everyday comfort in a wear-with-anything black-and-white color scheme — and prepare to style it for seasons to come.
“The one standout quality all my favorite shoes share? They quietly elevate the entire look without announcing themselves. Whether it’s a sculptural heel or a perfectly proportioned loafer, the shoe never competes — it anchors,” Volpe shares.
Another sneaker Volpe recommends for winter-to-spring dressing? A low-profile option with subtle contrast detailing. “It pairs just as well with tailoring as [with] denim and doesn’t feel gym-coded,” she says. “They’re design-led, not performance-led — which is what keeps them seasonless and fashion-credible.”
If traditional loafers aren’t for you, never fear: Volpe explains that “transitional seasons are all about flexible structure,” citing backless loafers and mules as smart silhouettes to have in your wardrobe. This pair has earned hundreds of five-star ratings from shoppers for its “classy and elegant” look and “incredibly comfortable” feel.
Volpe specifically calls out Alohas flats as one of her favorite shoes for seasonal transitions, highlighting the fact that they’re “directional without being loud.” She adds, “the brand’s leather flats feel intentional, especially styled with socks now and bare ankles later. They have enough structure to ground winter outfits, but enough lightness to feel right in spring — no costume shift required.”
Extend the seasonality of your favorite flats and loafers by wearing them with socks or tights — like these — in colder temperatures.
If you struggle to stray from your comfy sneakers, a simple color shift may be all you need to feel updated for spring. “Think softened neutrals,” Volpe shares. “A pale espresso loafer or an off-white sneaker feels fresh without screaming, ‘new season.’”
The sign of a good ballet flat? One that looks “refined, intentional, and endlessly wearable,” says Volpe. This two-toned pair combines an affordable price point with a polished finish that looks “expensive,” according to one five-star reviewer.

title: Woman Checked Pet Camera to See How Her Dog and New Rescue Canine Were Getting Along. What She Saw Shocked Her
description: Pet camera footage of an Illinois woman’s newly adopted rescue dog, Charlie, and her black Labrador retriever, Rambo, is going viral. The woman, who goes by Mare on TikTok, shared how the dogs were getting along while she and her husband were both at work.
content:
Footage of the woman’s newly adopted rescue dog, Charlie, and her black Lab, Rambo, is going viral
An Illinois woman is feeling like a lucky dog after checking her pet camera.
Marilyn Ewing, who goes by Mare on TikTok, shared camera footage of how her newly adopted rescue dog, Charlie, was getting along with her black Labrador, Rambo, while she and her husband, Austin Ewing, were at work.
In a clip posted on TikTok, Charlie can be seen somewhat shyly curled up on an elevated dog bed, sniffing a blanket, before Rambo hops on the bed to cuddle and comfort him.
“BRUH😭,” Mare simply captioned the heartwarming video that has since been viewed more than 170,000 times and liked over 25,000 times.
One TikTok user who watched the video imagined what Rambo “probably” was saying to Charlie while comforting him.
“It’s going to be okay. Our parents are pretty cool. Just relax with me bud,” they commented.
Mare spoke about the viral video with Newsweek, explaining that it was captured the day after she and her husband adopted Charlie.
“Our shelter dog, Charlie, was days away from being euthanized at a kill shelter in Oklahoma, so our local shelter went and picked him up and brought him back to where we live in Illinois,” she said. 
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

Shocked by the sweet moment between her new sibling pets, Mare added, “I couldn't wait to get home to see them. Now, they are best friends!”
Mare has posted other moments of Charlie in his new forever home. 
In another TikTok video, Rambo can be seen trying to teach Charlie an important household activity.
Mare wrote on top of the clip, “POV: Your friendly lab is trying to teach the new shelter pup how to [use] the pet door 😂❤️.”

title: Amazon Quietly Marked Down Ugg Boots, Clogs, and Sandals for Up to 62% Off — Snag These 7 Pairs from $30
description: Amazon has Ugg boots and shoes to wear now through spring on sale for up to 62 percent off. The best Amazon deals on Uggs, including suede boots, platform sneakers, trendy clogs, and fuzzy slides, start at just $30 on Amazon
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Including styles to wear now and into spring
My winter wardrobe revolves around my Ugg boots collection, which has been put through the wringer this season and is in dire need of an upgrade. Fortunately, I don’t have to look too far to find a new pair (or two) for cheap.
Amazon is having a massive sale on Ugg shoes right now and popular styles are up to 60 percent off — including mini boots, slip-on clogs, and fuzzy slides, as well as versatile styles from its sister brand Koolaburra by Ugg. Prices start at just $30, so what are you waiting for? Brave the cold in style and snag yourself a pair before time runs out on these can’t-miss deals.
Amazon shoppers are selling out these fleece-lined micro boots, which “slip on and off really easily” and feel “like you're walking around in slippers.” They’re a close lookalike for the Ugg boots Sarah Jessica Parker has been wearing on repeat — and according to another reviewer, they’re “well worth the splurge for their comfort.”
Of all the Y2K fashion trends making a comeback, clogs are definitely my favorite — even Jennifer Garner is on board. This suede pair has footbeds made from flexible EVA material that contours to your feet for personalized comfort and support. The shoes have racked up over 1,900 five-star ratings, including from one shopper who said they’re “like walking on pillows made of clouds.” 
If you’re shopping for a heeled boot, opt for this combat-style from Ugg’s sister brand Koolaburra. They have a subtle lift thanks to the thick lug soles, plus rear pull tabs for added convenience and cushy foam insoles. 
Stylish yet comfortable, these lace-up sneakers are available in four neutral designs and sizes 4–14. Their uppers are made from a combination of soft suede and mesh, and a padded rim around the ankle prevents the risk of friction, blisters, and slippage.  
Get a headstart on your spring footwear lineup and snag these cushioned platform sandals while they’re as little as $30. They have a lightweight design with adjustable ankle straps and foam insoles, making them ideal for all-day wear and traveling. Pick them up in beige, brown, black, or olive green.
From the open-toe silhouette to the moisture-wicking sheepskin lining, these lightweight slides earn high praise for their coziness and versatility. Style them with a matching lounge set, an oversized crewneck and leggings (a.k.a. the perfect lazy day outfit), or a sweater and jeans. 
These structured mini boots are crafted in waterproof suede with faux-fur lining, heel tabs, thick rubber soles for maximum traction, and a warm padded collar. To sum it up: They’ll endure whatever Mother Nature throws at them whether it’s snow, rain, or sunshine. “For those with weak ankles, feet issues, and [who are] clumsy as heck, these boots are a 10/10,” wrote a five-star reviewer, who called them “my new favorite winter shoes.”

title: Jennifer Garner’s Silhouette-Enhancing Dress Resembles This Amazon Style That 'Looks Way More Expensive Than It Is'
description: Jennifer Garner wore a brown dress while attending the Mac Barnett and Jennifer Garner Consider The Picture Book event in New York City. We rounded up similar flattering belted shirt dresses at Amazon, and prices start at $36
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Plus, more dresses inspired by her look from $36
Celebrity fashion trends may be fleeting, but Jennifer Garner just proved this popular color isn’t going anywhere.
The actress previously attended the Mac Barnett and Jennifer Garner Consider The Picture Book event in New York City while wearing the unexpected hue that’s taken over Kate Hudson’s, Jessica Alba’s, and our editors’ wardrobes: chocolate brown. 
While Garner’s take on the trend — a silhouette-enhancing, belted brown dress – looked like the epitome of an effortless winter outfit, we couldn’t help but notice how easily it could work for spring, too. Shop flattering options inspired by her dress at Amazon from $36.
A close match for Garner’s dress, this waist-cinching style has earned high praise from Amazon shoppers for its “elegant and versatile” design and “very comfortable” fit. One reviewer appreciated that it “skims the body in all the right places, offering a flattering fit without being too tight or too loose,” while another wrote that it “looks way more expensive than it is.” Copy the actress by pairing it with tall black boots, or dress it up with shimmery black kitten heels.
If you’re looking for a warmer dress to wear this winter, consider picking up this knit option that “looks and feels expensive,” according to one Amazon shopper. Its wool-blend fabric and long sleeves will keep you toasty in chilly temperatures, while its detachable belt offers figure definition. Channel Garner by snagging it in chocolate brown, or choose from six additional colors, including burgundy and navy blue.
Not sure what to wear to any upcoming weddings? Let this Garner-inspired dress take out the guesswork. While its belted waist, long sleeves, and V-neckline call to mind the actress’s dress, its ruched fabric and silky satin fabric feel better suited for more formal occasions. Plus, one shopper called it “perfect for a wedding,” explaining that it “feels and looks very luxurious.” 
Keep scrolling to shop more brown dresses inspired by Jennifer Garner below.

title: Uber Driver Convicted of Sexual Battery of College Student Who Was His Passenger
description: Safiullah Miakhil, a former Uber driver in California, has been convicted of sexually assaulting his passenger who got in his vehicle after a Halloween party in 2023.
content:
Deputy District Attorney Stefanie DeCillis commended the victim for "testifying at trial about such a traumatic event"
A California Uber driver has been convicted of sexually assaulting his passenger. 
On Friday, Feb. 6, the Yolo County District Attorney’s Office said in a press release that 46-year-old Safiullah Miakhil of Carmichael was convicted of two counts of sexual battery related to a Nov. 1, 2023, incident. 
Judge Catherine R. Hohenwarter presided over the case.
The victim, whose name and age were not disclosed, was a student at the University of California, Davis, at the time, authorities said.
PEOPLE reached out to Uber for comment, but did not immediately receive a response.
Just after midnight on Halloween 2023, Miakhil picked the woman up from a Halloween party in Davis and brought her to her home. As the two arrived, he exited the vehicle and got into the back seat with her. 
He then groped, kissed and fondled the victim against her will before she was able to break free and run away.
The incident was immediately reported to police.
“The young woman who was victimized in this case demonstrated immeasurable courage and tenacity, from the time of the assault in 2023, while the case took its course through the criminal court system, and especially in testifying at trial about such a traumatic event,” Yolo County Deputy District Attorney Stefanie DeCillis said.
DeCillis also thanked the jury for making the correct choice in a case of this magnitude.
“This outcome signals that sexual assault cases, especially against those in vulnerable positions, will be treated with the utmost seriousness in Yolo County,” she said.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.
District Attorney Jeff Reisig added, “The jury’s conviction is an affirmation to the courageous young victim in this case and a warning to the depraved who dare to think that they will get away with such perverse misconduct.” 
“We urge all riders to use caution when utilizing ride-sharing services and report any and all misconduct by drivers to authorities,” he said.
Miakhil faces a maximum sentence of one year in county jail. It is not immediately known if he has obtained an attorney.
If you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted, please contact the National Sexual Assault Hotline at 1-800-656-HOPE (4673) or go to rainn.org.

title: Kaley Cuoco Recalls Struggling with Depression During Divorce: 'I Literally Thought I Was Gonna Die'
description: Kaley Cuoco is opening up about difficulties she experienced during her 2022 divorce — including depression right before a big premiere. The Big Bang Theory alum, 40, spoke candidly on 'The Drew Barrymore Show' this week about how she decided to get into a relationship again following her divorce.
content:
"I woke up that morning, I was so depressed and so sad I couldn't even breathe," the actress shared
Kaley Cuoco is opening up about difficulties she experienced during her 2022 divorce — including depression.
During a Monday, Feb. 9, appearance on the Drew Barrymore Show, the Big Bang Theory alum, 40, spoke candidly about how her mental health journey following her divorce from Karl Cook in 2022.
"I had like the crazy story when this is a handful of years ago, when I said that I was going through my divorce... it was the premiere of the second season of Flight Attendant," she said, referring to the April 2022 premiere of the HBO Max series.
"I woke up that morning, I was so depressed and so sad I couldn't even breathe, and I was just lying on the floor. I literally thought I was gonna die, I really did," she shared. "I said, 'What am I doing?' And it was like the worst morning of my life, but knowing the night was coming, it was supposed to be the best night of my life. It's so crazy those things sometimes happen at the same time."
Cuoco recalled her team stepping in to help her get ready for the event.
"I couldn't get up," she continued. "I'm like, 'I can't go. I can't go anywhere.' I just blew up my life. My life's over. I truly thought that."
At the time, the 8 Simple Rules alum thought she was "never getting married again, never gonna have kids."
"I knew when I was lying on that floor in my house, I thought, 'Oh my God, this is what they talk about. This is the lowest point I could get,' " she shared — before revealing that she met her now-fiancé Tom Pelphrey just three weeks later.
"That's, like, supposed to be the best night ever of my career, and I literally saw my soul leave my body," Cuoco added. "It still chokes me up because I can remember it so clearly, but it made me a whole new person."
During her difficult time, Cuoco learned that it's okay to have a change heart — especially after declaring that you'll never get married again.
"You know what, guys, sometimes you just change your mind and that's okay," she said. " ... You probably didn't know I was lying on the floor before my premiere, ready to die ... But it takes a long time to figure that out and a lot of forgiveness."
The Flight Attendant star publicly confirmed her relationship with Ozark actor Pelphrey in May 2022, and in March 2023, the couple welcomed their daughter, Matilda Carmine Richie Pelphrey.
They then got engaged more than one year after Matilda's arrival in August 2024.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Prior to her marriage to Cook, Cuoco was also married to former tennis player Ryan Sweeting from December 2013 to September 2015.
Since she and Pelphrey went public with their relationship, Cuoco has been candid about her love for the actor. Speaking to PEOPLE in November, the star shared that she and her fiancé "would love to find" a project to work on together in the future.
"We're actually actively searching. It has to be the right one," she said on Nov. 7. "It has to be special, but 100%. There's no one I'd rather work with than Tom."
She adds, "In fact, I'm jealous of everyone that gets to work with him because he's the best."
Pelphrey echoed a similar sentiment, telling PEOPLE in September, "If you would’ve told me 15 years ago that I could be with the love of my life and have the most perfect baby and get to do what I love, it’s wild. You’re living your dream. And I’m very conscious of that."
If you or someone you know needs mental health help, text "STRENGTH" to the Crisis Text Line at 741-741 to be connected to a certified crisis counselor.

title: My Boyfriend Won’t Know I Shopped for His Valentine’s Gift on a $50 Budget Thanks to These Finds That Feel Luxe
description: Shopping for Valentine’s Day gifts for men? We tracked down the best presents on a $50 budget. Top picks include Lululemon joggers, Vuori shorts, Stanley beer mugs, Bombas slippers, Summer Fridays face masks, and a sunrise alarm clock. Our budget-friendly picks span fashion, tech, sports, kitchen, and self-care finds
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Including editor-loved adjustable weights
I treat every Valentine’s Day as a personal challenge. How do I top last year’s present to my boyfriend? Previously, I’ve gifted him everything from a swanky golf-club fitting to a limited-edition print from his favorite artist. Since we’re traveling over this year's holiday, we’ve decided to have a more affordable approach to gifting. 
Still, a tighter budget isn’t going to stop me from impressing him. I took to the internet and found loads of luxe options, including comfy Lululemon joggers, breathable Hey Dude loafers, a smashed burger kit, and more. These $50-and-under gifts are sure to bring a smile to your man’s face — trust me, I’ve already given some of them myself. 
Among my favorite finds is this pair of soft jersey joggers from Lululemon. They’re lightweight enough for my boyfriend, who runs hot, cozy courtesy of the brushed interior, and stretchy without looking frumpy. I imagine him wearing these during snuggly evenings on the couch and long travel days. 
We’re not gifting packs of socks to our guys anymore. Hint, hint: Because we actually want them to be excited to unwrap their presents. But, I did recently buy my boyfriend this pair of sock-like slippers from Bombas, and he hasn’t taken them off since. I also recommend this best-selling pair of slip-on loafers from HeyDude, which one reviewer shared, “feel like you are not wearing shoes at all.”
These golf shorts tick all of the boxes: They’re lightweight, quick-drying, and stretchy. Plus, their inseam isn’t too short, which allows for even more comfortable movement. The material has UPF 30+, which provides extra sun protection during a balmy 18 holes.
A gifting tip? Keep an eye out for a clever gadget that will improve your sweetie’s daily life. For example, my boyfriend’s hips and legs go through the wringer during golf season, so a powerful massage gun provides relief to his aching muscles. I also recommend this wireless charger that can be set up on a desk or bedside table to accommodate an iPhone, AirPods, and Apple Watch at the same time. For music lovers, check out this portable JBL speaker that’s completely waterproof. 
Being awoken by gentle light and music sets the tone for the rest of his day. This calming alarm clock does just that, plus comes with 26 sleep sounds. A design aspect I’m impressed with? There’s a built-in battery that ensures timely wake-ups even if there’s a power outage. “It’s a more affordable alternative to the popular (but pricey) Hatch alarm clock,” shared one customer. 
Whether your boo likes to watch sports or play them, the gifts below check all athletics-related boxes. I found a sleek gym bag that he won’t feel embarrassed bringing into the office, a hat with his favorite baseball team on it — I did my research, MLB season is on the horizon — and a camping chair that’s like a foldable love seat. Not to mention, my boyfriend is obsessed with practicing on his indoor putting green during winter. 
These adjustable weights are so clever that I want to buy them for my boyfriend just so I can use them. The customizable set can be used as lone dumbbell plates, hand weights, or bar bells. I know my boyfriend would appreciate this product’s adaptability in order to execute everything from hammer curls to sumo squats. Shopping editor Clint Davis has this exact set of weights and says they're durable and that changing the weights is super easy.
In my world, cooking is a love language — some of my favorite quality-time is spent making dinner with my boyfriend. As such, I have my eye on this cast iron skillet that’s ideal for searing steaks and frying eggs, as well as this pasta maker that makes quick work of homemade dough. Plus, when the weather (eventually) warms, a smashed burger kit (that landed a spot on Oprah’s Favorite Things list) will make for fun evenings over the grill. 
Truth be told, my boyfriend bought this for himself. But! That just goes to show that it’s something men want. Perks of this purchase: It looks sleek in our kitchen, brews enough coffee for the two of us, and is easy to use. I also really appreciate that the entire contraption is dishwasher safe.
A good gift can also remind your honey to slow down and take care of themselves. Implementing new self-care practices is as easy as a foot massager that can be stowed furtively under a desk or a pack of de-puffing eye patches.
This fragrance-free face mask is the solution to dull, dry skin. Plus, it can be used as a moisturizer, 10-minute face mask, or overnight mask. Ingredients like hyaluronic acid hydrate and plump, while cucumber extract soothes. Reviewers agree it's a key part of their skincare routine throughout winter.

title: Michelle Pfeiffer Wore the Wide-Leg Pants Style We've Spotted on Julia Roberts and Jennifer Garner, Too
description: Sick of skinny jeans and tight pants? Take a page out of Michelle Pfeiffer’s book and opt for wide-leg pants instead. Julia Roberts and Jennifer Garner also wear the roomy silhouette. Below, score similar pairs at Amazon for under $50. Included are palazzo pants, pleated pairs, and more
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
No one does fashion like Michelle Pfeiffer. 
On February 3, the 67-year-old star looked particularly polished at an Apple TV press day. She wore a silky white button-up and beige wide-leg pants, the latter of which were the focus of her functional yet fashionable ’fit. 
The bottoms’ most eye-catching quality was the deep front pleats that made her 5-foot-7-inch frame look even taller. Additionally, the pants had plenty of room throughout, meaning they would also be comfortable enough for occasions with long periods of time spent sitting (cough,cough, the office!). Plus, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Garner, and other stars also favor wide-leg pants. And now you can, too, with these picks starting at $23.  
Prettygarden left no stone untouched when crafting these pants: They have gorgeous front pleats and a “linen-like” fabric, per the brand, that washes easily at home. They’re also the most affordable out of the bunch. They have a side zipper instead of bulky front buttons, as well as a tie belt that “sets off the waist beautifully,” said a shopper who received the pants for free. TL;DR: They’re going to be ultra-forgiving. 
Anytime I see the words “slimming” and “they don't wrinkle” — as I did in this shopper’s review of these bottoms— I’m immediately convinced to add the item to my cart. On top of that, this pair, also from Prettygarden, has elastic in the waistband, so they won’t be digging into my skin all day. 
They also remind me so much of a pair I wore during my grad school era, which involved lots of commuting and desk-sitting. And still, I paired them with everything from blazers to sneakers to T-shirts and even routinely broke them out on the weekends. 
If you thought the roomy bottoms couldn’t get any more comfortable, think again: Palazzo pants are basically just wider wide-leg pants. They also look shorter than some of the other pairs, which, contrary to popular opinion, might actually be more useful in the winter. (I don’t know about you, but I hate when my pant hems get soggy and wet from the snow.) There are also 29 — yes, 29 — colors to choose from. 
Keep scrolling to shop more wide-leg pants inspired by Michelle Pfeiffer now.

title: Bill Clinton Says He’s ‘Called for the Full Release of the Epstein Files’ But It’s ‘Still Not Enough’ for Republicans
description: Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton were called to testify in the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. However, on Feb. 6, the former president said he believes they should testify for a public hearing rather than a filmed closed-door deposition.
content:
The former president is calling for his upcoming filmed deposition to be a public hearing, so the "American people can see for themselves what this is really about"
Eugene Gologursky/Getty for The New York Times; Rick Friedman/Corbis via Getty
Bill Clinton says that despite his call to release the Jeffrey Epstein files, his attempts at transparency have not appeased the Republicans on the House Oversight Committee.
In a series of posts shared to X on Friday, Feb. 6. Clinton shared that he had agreed to "appear in person" before the House Oversight Committee, a move he says was "still not enough" for the Republicans on the Committee.
Clinton reiterated that he has already "called for the full release" of the Epstein files, and that he has "provided a sworn statement of what I know" to the Committee.
In a second post, Clinton noted that House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer "says he wants cameras," referring to a Feb. 2 agreement in which the Clintons would give a closed-door deposition.
"Who benefits from this arrangement? It’s not Epstein’s victims, who deserve justice," Clinton wrote. "Not the public, who deserve the truth. It serves only partisan interests. This is not fact-finding, it’s pure politics."
The former president and his wife, Hillary Clinton, were both called to testify before the House Oversight Committee’s investigation into Epstein in August 2025. In mid-January, they both wrote a joint public letter saying that they would not testify, despite calls for both to give depositions.
House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer held a vote to hold them in criminal contempt if they don’t testify. Weeks later, the two politicians agreed to the closed-door deposition under threat of a subpoena.
Hillary is scheduled to testify on Feb. 26, and Bill is to testify on Feb. 27. However, on Thursday, Feb. 5, Hillary, 78, said that she and the former president were demanding a public hearing.
"If you want this fight, @RepJamesComer, let’s have it—in public," Hillary wrote in a post to her X account. "You love to talk about transparency. There’s nothing more transparent than a public hearing, cameras on."
The House Oversight Committee replied to Hillary on X., and posted screenshots of emails from the Clintons' attorneys agreeing to the conditions.
“Then they pretended that we were moving the goalpost when they received, along with the subpoenas, the House deposition guidance that explicitly mentions video recordings," the Committee's official Twitter account posted.
Bill noted in a third post on Feb. 6 that he “will not sit idly as they use me as a prop in a closed-door kangaroo court by a Republican Party running scared.”
“If they want answers, let’s stop the games & do this the right way: in a public hearing, where the American people can see for themselves what this is really about," he continued.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. 
Rick Friedman Photography/Corbis via Getty
The X posts come after Bill and Hillary were first subpoenaed in August 2025. When the DOJ released some of the Epstein files in December 2025, Bill was featured in multiple photographs. He has denied any wrongdoing.

title: Margot Robbie Wore a Bustier and Mini Skirt Set That’s Older Than She Is. But Her Shoes Stole the Show
description: Margot Robbie wore an archival look from Vivienne Westwood with Christian Louboutin shoes while promoting her new film 'Wuthering Heights' in London.
content:
The Australian actress wore a look from Vivienne Westwood with Christian Louboutin shoes while in London promoting her new film 'Wuthering Heights'
Kate Green/Getty; Andrew Mukamal/Instagram
While attending the global content creator Q&A for her new film Wuthering Heights on Friday, Feb. 6, in London, the 35-year-old Australian actress wore an all-black look featuring a mini skirt set older than she is and gravity-defying heels.
Robbie's stylist ​​Andrew Mukamal confirmed in a social media post that her shoes were designed by Christian Louboutin. Her custom Conquillas were made in Italy, and are from the fall/winter 2014–15 line, according to The Metropolitan Museum of Art. 
The front and sides of the heelless platform are pointed and smooth, while the very back boasts a spiked design running from the bottom on up and topped with a bow.
“That shoe tho,” one person commented of the Barbie star’s look on Mukamal’s post, which included a close-up of the style. Another added, “THOSE. HEELS.”
The Big Bold Beautiful Journey actress wore the eye-catching shoes with an archival Vivienne Westwood leather two-piece set from fall 1988 collection, with a low cut and sleeveless, corset bust paired with a quilted, puffy mini skirt.
For Robbie's glam, Robbie kept her makeup natural with a nude lip and short, natural nails also in a nude shade. Her blonde hair flowed past her shoulders with a part down the center. 
For her press tour looks, Robbie, who plays Catherine Earnshaw opposite Jacob Elordi’s Heathcliff in Wuthering Heights, has stayed true to the film’s theme for the adaptation of the 1847 novel by Emily Brontë.
Just one day prior to her Westwood-Louboutin combo, the Suicide Squad actress turned heads with another Wuthering Heights promo tour look made of hair.
On Thursday, Feb. 5, London-based Turkish fashion designer Dilara Findikoglu crafted the gown specifically for Robbie, inspired by the Victorian Era's obsession with hair.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Earlier in the press tour, Robbie gifted her 28-year-old co-star with bespoke matching gold rings that were made by Cece Jewellery’s Cece Fein-Hughes, who has also designed for Taylor Swift. The pieces include an inscription of a Brontë quote ("Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same") as well as Cathy and Heathcliff’s initials and "1847-2026," a reference to the year the book was published and that of the new film’s release, per British Vogue.
Wuthering Heights is in theaters Feb. 13.

title: I'm Replacing My Outdated Leggings with These 10 Pairs of Comfy (and Stylish) Sweatpants on Amazon, from $10
description: Ditch your tight, restrictive leggings in favor of comfortable sweatpants that are perfect for travel, exercise, and lounging. We rounded up 10 pairs of comfy sweatpants on Amazon from brands like Nike, Hanes, Varley, and Cozy Earth starting at just $10
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Including styles from Nike, Hanes, and Cozy Earth
Pants with buttons and zippers? You can keep ’em — I’m wearing comfy sweatpants instead.
I frequently eschew jeans in favor of more comfortable styles. And while I love wearing leggings because of the elastic waistband, sometimes they’re still a bit too restrictive for my liking. Enter: comfy sweatpants, which are quickly becoming my entire personality — I’m already obsessed with sweatpant jeans and velour pants, so this is the next step in my style evolution. They’ll be perfect for long travel days, Pilates workouts, running errands, and just lounging at home with a book. 
I rounded up 10 pairs of comfy sweatpants on Amazon from brands like Hanes, Nike, Varley, and Cozy Earth, starting at just $10.
These sweats are one of Amazon’s top five best-selling sweatpants with over 55,000 five-star ratings, and it’s easy to see why. They’re designed in the brand’s cozy EcoSmart fleece with a ribbed-knit waistband and subtle wide-leg silhouette, and they come in sizes S–XXL with both petite and regular inseams available.
I’ve been curious about Varley for quite some time, and these comfy sweatpants with a ruched waistband and thick elastic cuffs are definitely calling my name. “These are wonderful,” one shopper raved, calling them “so soft and such good quality.”
If you want slouchier, more lightweight sweatpants, try these joggers with a contrast drawstring around the elastic waistband and curved front pockets. They come in 19 colors, like black, charcoal gray, pink, and brown, plus sizes S–XXL.
I already own these jogger pants in charcoal gray, and I love that the 26-inch inseam fits my petite frame perfectly. They’re crafted in a buttery blend of bamboo viscose, acrylic, and spandex with a drawstring waistband and deep, angled side pockets. 
When I think of comfy sweatpants, this pair embodies that phrase to a T. The wide-leg pants are made from a blend of cotton and polyester fleece, with a ruched drawstring waistband and side pockets. They come in 17 colors and sizes S–XL.
Just because you’re wearing comfy sweatpants doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice style — and this bold red pair is ready to be noticed. The pants have an elastic waistband with an internal adjustable drawstring and elasticized cuffs that work equally well with slippers or tucked into boots.
I let out an audible gasp when I found these comfy sweatpants, which are made even more cozy thanks to fuzzy fleece lining. I also love the contrast drawcords around the waist and the fun range of 14 color options.
Whether you have a long plane ride or grueling workout ahead of you, these wide-leg sweatpants are ready to keep you comfy for hours on end. “They don’t look frumpy like traditional sweatpants — I’ve even worn them to work,” one shopper said. “[They’re] the only pair of sweatpants I’ve found that are both comfortable and fit my petite frame.”
I know I said I don’t wear denim, but I make an exception for barrel jeans since they’re so comfortable. However, I have a feeling these barrel sweatpants are about to replace the jeans altogether. They have a ruched drawstring waist, curved front pockets, and visible side seams, and they come in 18 colors.
Cargo pants have made the style rounds on celebs like Oprah Winfrey and Mindy Kaling, and you can get in on the action with these Nike sweatpants. The pull-on pants have oversized side cargo pockets and elasticized cuffs, and they come in sizes XS–XXL.

title: Missing Mom’s Car Was Found on the Interstate. Her Daughter Doesn’t Think She 'Pulled Over on Her Own'
description: As authorities in South Carolina continue to search for Sabrina Heinz, a missing 49-year-old woman whose car was found abandoned on the interstate, her family's concern is growing.
content:
Sabrina Heinz was last seen over a week ago on Jan. 28 while working at a gas station in South Carolina
Richland County Sheriff's Department
As authorities in South Carolina continue to search for a missing 49-year-old woman whose car was found abandoned on the interstate, her family's concern is growing.
“My only thing is, I just want her home,” Sage Goodwin told Fox affiliate WACH about mom Sabrina Heinz on Thursday, Feb. 5. "It's day 8 now and it's scary."
Heinz was last seen on Jan. 28 around 10 p.m. local time working at a Shell gas station, according to the Richland County Sheriff’s Department and WACH.
Authorities were notified two days later, on Jan. 30, by the woman’s supervisor, who was concerned when Heinz didn’t show up at work, The State, CBS affiliate WLTX and NBC affiliate WYFF previously reported.
Heinz’s employer turned on the GPS monitoring of the woman's company vehicle, which was then located on the shoulder of Interstate 77 in Blythewood.
Inside, the sheriff's department found a number of personal items, including her phone, Sgt. Molly Nations told NBC and CW affiliate WIS-TV.
“It was turned on, but because there was no gas, it was not cranked, but as if it had just run out. The key was still on,” Nations told the outlet. “She means a lot to her family, and it’s very important to us that we bring her home safely.”
In her recent interview with CBS affiliate WLTX, Goodwin described Heinz as a devoted grandmother, daughter, sister and friend. 
Asked if her mother had a possible medical condition that may have led her to wander off, Goodwin stated, “Not that we know of. She’s never told us anything about it.”
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. 
Authorities intensified their search for Heinz on Thursday, including checking both sides of the interstate where her car was found, WACH reported. 
Goodwin also told the outlet that she had her own suspicions about what may have happened. 
“Now that I’ve seen pictures of the car,” Goodwin told WACH, “I don’t think my mom just pulled over on her own. I honestly feel like someone pushed her over or she was running from something."
PEOPLE contacted the Richland County Sheriff’s Department and Samantha Heinz on Friday, Feb. 6, but did not receive immediate comment.
Heinz is described by authorities as being 5’2” and 160 lbs, and she was last seen wearing a short sleeve, collared red shirt with a black long sleeve underneath and black pants. 
Those with information on Heinz’s whereabouts should call 911 or the sheriff’s department at 803-576-3000.

title: GOP Senator Calls Video of Obamas as Apes 'the Most Racist Thing I've Seen' from Trump as White House Dismisses 'Fake Outrage'
description: Republican Sen. Tim Scott has criticized a video that President Donald Trump shared on his Truth Social account Thursday night that includes a racist depiction of former President Barack Obama and his wife, Michelle Obama, as primates
content:
South Carolina Sen. Tim Scott, who backed Trump's 2024 presidential campaign, urged the president to remove his post before it was ultimately taken down
Republican Sen. Tim Scott has criticized a video that President Donald Trump shared on his Truth Social account Thursday night that includes a racist depiction of former President Barack Obama and his wife, Michelle Obama, as primates.
"Praying it was fake because it's the most racist thing I've seen out of this White House," Scott, who is Black and represents South Carolina, said in a post on X on Friday, Feb. 6. "The President should remove it."
Scott endorsed Trump for president in 2024 after dropping out of the Republican primary race.
The 62-second video that Trump shared on Truth Social centered around election conspiracy theories, alleging that voting machines in battleground states had been tampered with as the 2020 presidential votes were tallied.
In the final seconds of the clip, two primates, with the Obamas' smiling faces imposed on them, appear as the song "The Lion Sleeps Tonight" by The Tokens plays in the background. The post amplified Trump's debunked claims that the 2020 election was stolen from him.

The depiction of the nation's first Black president and first lady as primates — during Black History Month — advances a longstanding racist trope used by slave traders and segregationists to dehumanize Black people and justify their mistreatment.

White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt defended Trump's post in a statement shared with PEOPLE on Friday morning.
"This is from an internet meme video depicting President Trump as the King of the Jungle and Democrats as characters from the Lion King," Leavitt, 28, said. "Please stop the fake outrage and report on something today that actually matters to the American public."
Amid the widespread backlash that followed, the White House deleted Trump's post and shared a new statement to PEOPLE, saying: "A White House staffer erroneously made the post. It has been taken down."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer.

The video drew swift condemnation on social media, including from House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, the first Black caucus leader in Congress, who praised the Obamas on X as "brilliant, compassionate and patriotic Americans" who "represent the best of this country."

Jeffries called Trump "vile" and "unhinged" and demanded that every Republican "immediately denounce Donald Trump's disgusting bigotry."
The press office for California Gov. Gavin Newsom shared a similar call, saying the Truth Social post represented "disgusting behavior by the President" and added: "Every single Republican must denounce this. Now."
Echoing Scott, Republican Rep. Mike Lawler of New York took to X on Friday and said, "The President's post is wrong and incredibly offensive — whether intentional or a mistake — and should be deleted immediately with an apology offered."
PEOPLE reached out to a spokesperson for the Obamas for comment.
Trump has a history of making degrading remarks about the Obamas and other people of color, including Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar, a vocal Trump critic, and other Somali immigrants whom he called "garbage" in recent months and urged to "go back to where they came from."
During Obama's presidency, Trump promoted false claims that the 44th president, who was born in Hawaii, was actually born in Kenya and was constitutionally ineligible to serve.
Trump also repeatedly demanded that his predecessor produce birth records and prove he was a "natural-born citizen," a requirement to become president. In her memoir, Becoming, Michelle said she'd never forgive Trump for stirring up the false "birther" movement in 2011, thereby endangering the Obamas' two daughters, Sasha and Malia (then 10 and 13).
"The whole thing was crazy and mean-spirited, of course, its underlying bigotry and xenophobia hardly concealed," she wrote. "But it was also dangerous, deliberately meant to stir up the wingnuts and kooks."

title: Halle Berry Gets Engaged to Van Hunt After 5 Years of Dating: 'He Did Put a Little Ring on It'
description: Halle Berry confirmed her engagement to partner Van Hunt during an appearance on ‘The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.’ The actress showed her dazzling ring as she cleared up confusion about Hunt’s previous marriage proposal to her.
content:
The actress confimed her engagement to partner Van Hunt during an appearance on ‘The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon’
Halle Berry is ready to walk down the aisle with Van Hunt!
Berry, 59, announced the next milestone in their relationship during an appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon on Thursday, Feb. 5. The actress told host Jimmy Fallon that fans have some "confusion" about her and Hunt's relationship status after their almost six years of dating.
"There's some confusion that he asked to marry me and I said no," Berry said.
"But, that's not the case?" Fallon asked after Berry was interrupted by a "jealous" heckler in the audience.
"No, that's not the case," she said. "I did not say 'no,' we just don't have a date. Of course, I said 'yes, I would marry him.' "
"I'm so happy, you guys are a great couple," Fallon said. "Security, please have that guy taken out, bye," he joked, referring to the heckler. "No. I'm so happy, you guys are a great couple. Congratulations."
Showing her engagement ring, Berry said of Hunt, "Thank you. He did put a little ring on it."
Fallon was visibly surprised by the size of the rock on Berry's ring finger saying, "Oh, a little."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Berry's decision to publicly confirm her engagement to Hunt comes after he revealed back in June 2025 that he had already proposed to her, but she said no. 
"I put out the proposal, and it’s still on hold as you can see," the singer-songwriter told Today.com after having his first joint interview with Berry on the June 4 episode of Today with Jenna & Friends. "It’s just out there floating. You know, maybe you can encourage her."
At the time, Berry rejected his proposal because of their past failed marriages.
The Catwoman star previously tied the knot three times. She was married to her first ex-husband, former MLB player David Justice, from 1993 to 1997; second ex-husband, singer-actor Eric Benét, from 2001 to 2005, and third ex-husband Olivier Martinez from 2013 to 2016.
Meanwhile, Hunt has been divorced once.
"We don’t feel like we have to get married to validate our love in any way. We don't,” Berry told the outlet, later noting, "I think we will get married just because, out of the people I’ve been married to, this is the person I should have married. And I feel like I should, we should get married, but it’s not because we feel like we have to. I think it’s something that we would like to do just because we want that expression."
The duo first met in 2020 and bonded virtually during the COVID-19 pandemic. Berry made her relationship with Hunt Instagram official in September 2020 after months of teasing a new romance. She confirmed she was dating the "Seconds Of Pleasure" singer by sharing a cheeky photo of herself wearing Hunt's tour merchandise.
"Now ya know... ♥️🦶🏽," Berry wrote in the caption. Her foot emoji referenced two Instagram posts she shared in July 2020 and August 2020 of her feet playing footsie with her new beau.
At the time, a source told PEOPLE the couple had been seeing each other for "several months" and that he had met Berry's two children. Berry shares 12-year-old son Maceo with ex Martinez. She's also a mother to 17-year-old daughter Nahla, whom she shares with ex Gabriel Aubry.
Hunt and Berry made their red carpet debut together at the 2021 Academy Awards. Later that year in October, Berry gushed about Hunt at the Elle Women in Hollywood Awards, giving him a special shout out. "My love, love, love — my sweetheart," she said. "I've never had a man that has lifted me up and let me be all that I am."
The following month in November 2021, the pair had an impromptu "commitment ceremony," performed by a then-8-year-old Maceo.
"This was a ceremony by an 8-year-old in the back seat of the car who said, 'Mom, you should get married to him.' I said, 'Really, I should marry him?' " Berry explained on Live with Kelly and Ryan. "He said, 'Yeah, I pronounce you man and wife.' So we're like, 'Oh, okay. We're married!' But we're not married. So, that's our commitment ceremony."
Over the years, the couple has been open about their love for one another at events and on social media. 
In November 2021, Hunt detailed his favorite qualities about Berry in an essay published on Berry's website "re-spin."
"Halle waits on nothing and leads the rhythm where she wants it to go. She knows that magic is made, and she was not made for waiting on it to happen," he wrote. "...There's a fairytale quality to her generosity that unfolds like a shimmering Christmas morning."
During the 4th Annual Celebration of Black Cinema & Television, Berry called Hunt "the love of my life." She said, "Because I failed so many times, I now know what [love] really looks like. And so my partner is here tonight, Van, and you have supported me."
Berry echoed these sentiments in September 2024, telling Marie Claire that Hunt is her "person." Of navigating their relationship, Berry said that it “took me a minute to get it right,” but “the nature of the way this happened, I have a real belief that this is it. This is my person.”

title: New Mom Hires Amish Woman as Nanny. She's Shocked by What She Does on Day One of the Job (Exclusive)
description: Jaclyn Shaw and her husband moved to a rural town in Northern Indiana, where they welcomed their first child together in 2022. They hired an Amish woman to help with childcare, and soon realized she was far more familiar with the modern world than assumed.
content:
Jaclyn Shaw and her husband moved to a rural town in Northern Indiana, where they welcomed their first child together in 2022
Jaclyn Shaw was born and raised in California, where one is unlikely to encounter someone who lives in the Amish tradition — or at least less likely than in a place like Northern Indiana, where she lived when she was starting a family.
Shaw's husband grew up in the Midwestern town where they relocated during the COVID-19 pandemic, so he was somewhat accustomed to the neighboring Amish population. He even went to school with some Amish kids, who often receive a "traditional" education until around eighth grade. Shaw, on the other hand, couldn't help but voice her shock every time they passed a horse and buggy along the road.
"I was always fascinated, like, 'Oh my gosh, there's an Amish person. How crazy,'" Shaw tells PEOPLE years after her initial move. "I was like, 'What in the world? I need to know more.'"
She was still curious when they welcomed their first child together, a daughter, and started raising her in that rural Indiana area. Since it was such a small, tight-knit community, there were only so many options for childcare. Shaw was hoping to get her daughter, who was born in June 2022, into a daycare program, but in the meantime, some of her husband's childhood friends suggested they might look into hiring an Amish nanny.
"They had Amish nannies for their children because they lived further out in the country," she explains. "There were actual Amish people that were their neighbors, and that's how they introduced that idea to me like, 'Oh, we had that and they were great. They took great care of the kids. They learned all the ways of farming and things like that.'"
While Shaw didn't necessarily need her daughter to learn how to work on a farm, she was certainly open to the idea of such a unique helping hand. That's when she met Rosanna, the 22-year-old Amish woman whom Shaw hired as a nanny, as she's since mentioned to her 33,000 TikTok followers in several videos.
Admittedly, the new mom was a little nervous when she and Rosanna initially met, worrying in part about sparking too much culture shock, but also about how Rosanna could best do her job. When Rosanna first asked to take her daughter for a walk, Shaw remembers feeling some hesitation. The nanny didn't have a phone, per Amish tradition, and wouldn't be able to call if something happened during the stroll.
Eventually, they got to a point of trusting each other, and since their town was so small, the California native ultimately allowed Rosanna to take the baby out without a means of constant communication.
Shaw also realized that despite the conservative, traditionalist nature of Rosanna's life, the young woman knew far more about modern life than one might expect. In the early days of Rosanna coming around, Shaw tiptoed around her, trying to avoid any awkward encounters.
"At first I treated her as if she was an alien a little bit," she says. "I just didn't want to say things that she didn't feel comfortable with or that she didn't know what I was talking about."
Since she worked from home, Shaw was able to guide Rosanna through the house, showing her things like their Google Home device and explaining that they often used it to play music for their daughter. Little did Shaw know, Rosanna had a relatively comprehensive understanding of things like technology, having just finished her Rumspringa, the rite of passage that allows many young Amish individuals to experience life and freedom outside of their communities.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
"The funniest thing that happened was literally the first day she was there, I had a keyboard in my house, just an electric keyboard," says Shaw. "When my daughter was sleeping, Rosanna just whipped out the keyboard and just started playing hymns and singing on the electric keyboard. I was like, 'What is going on?'"
After learning how much Rumspringa exposed Rosanna to the modern world, Shaw was curious to know more about the experience. "She told me a bit about hers, and I was like, 'Girl, I can't relate to you. I think you've done more things than I have,'" Shaw recalls with a laugh.

title: Lil Jon Confirms Son Nathan Smith, 27, Is Dead as Police Find Body in Area Pond
description: The Milton Police Department announced Feb. 6 that they had recovered a body that they believe to be Lil Jon's son Nathan Smith, a.k.a. DJ Young Slade, after the 27-year-old went missing from home on Feb. 3. A "heartbroken" Lil Jon confirmed his son's death in a statement, saying "his mother and I are devastated."
content:
Smith, a.k.a. DJ Young Slade, was reported missing from the family home on Tuesday, Feb. 3
Lil Jon's son is dead after a body was discovered in the area he had been reported missing from in Georgia.
On Friday, Feb. 6, the Milton Police Department released a statement on social media announcing that a body, which they believe to be the rapper's 27-year-old son Nathan Smith, was recovered from a pond.
In the statement, the police department wrote that after Smith went missing on Tuesday, Feb. 3, officers determined that he "had left his residence under unusual circumstances" and search efforts began.
"After being unable to locate Mr. Smith during that time, teams expanded the search to include a pond in Mayfield Park near Smith’s Milton residence," the statement read. "On February 6, 2026, at approximately 11:53 a.m., divers with the Cherokee County Fire Department located and recovered a body from the pond. The individual is believed to be Nathan Smith, pending official confirmation by the Fulton County Medical Examiner’s Office."
According to the statement, there is "no indication of foul play" but it continues to be "an open and active investigation."
"No further details will be released until the official cause and manner of death are determined by the Fulton County Medical Examiner and all investigative leads have been thoroughly examined," the statement concluded. "We extend our deepest condolences to the Smith family during this difficult time. The department respectfully asks the community and members of the media to honor the family’s request for privacy as they grieve and navigate this tragedy."
Shortly following the announcement, Lil Jon released a statement on the tragedy to PEOPLE.
"I am extremely heartbroken for the tragic loss of our son, Nathan Smith. His mother and I are devastated," he said. "Nathan was the kindest human being you would ever meet. He was immensely caring, thoughtful, polite, passionate, and warmhearted — he loved his family and the friends in his life to the fullest. He was an amazingly talented young man; a music producer, an artist and engineer, and graduate of NYU."
The statement continued, "We loved Nathan with all of our hearts and are incredibly proud of him. He was loved and appreciated, and in our last times together we’re comforted in knowing that we expressed that very sentiment to him."

"Thank you for all of the prayers and support in trying to locate him over the last several days," the statement concluded. "Thank you to the entire Milton Police Department involved: Detective Dula Milton, Investigators Sergeant Scott Lappin, Detective Randy Dula, Detective Sarah Moore, and Detective Daniel Williams. Sandy Springs Police Department, Fulton County Sheriff’s Office, Haralson County Sheriff’s Office, Cherokee Fire Department, Forsyth County Fire Department, Forsyth County Sheriff’s Office, Georgia K9 Team Search and Recovery, and multiple volunteers, as well as the Milton Fire Department and Cherokee Rescue and Dive Team, and Craig Brazemen."
The Milton Police Department issued the missing person report for the rapper's son on social media on Feb. 3, noting that Smith was last seen at 6 a.m. the same day "in the vicinity of Baldwin Dr./Mayfield Rd. in Milton."
"Subject ran out of his house and has been missing since. Subject left on foot and does not possess a phone. He may be disoriented and in need of assistance. Family and friends are concerned for his safety," the statement read.
In a statement shared with PEOPLE Tuesday, Lil Jon's rep said, "The family is asking for privacy at this time. We are also asking for continued prayers for Nathan to come home safe. Thank you."
The "Turn Down for What" rapper, born Jonathan Smith, shares Nathan with estranged wife Nicole Smith. Lil Jon, 53, and Smith tied the knot in 2004 and announced their "amicable split" in February 2024. In the announcement, they noted they broke up nearly two years prior.
Nathan was a DJ and musician who performs under the name DJ Young Slade or Slade. He released his latest single, "Feels," in March 2025.
Last year, Nathan appeared on MTV's Family Legacy and opened up about growing up with Lil Jon as a father in an interview with The Quintessential Gentleman.
"It’s dope to appreciate my dad, show respect, and just look at all the things he’s done, and it’s nice to get the torch passed down and do my own thing," Nathan said at the time. "Because it’s like it comes from him, but also I’m definitely taking it and making it my own."

Lil Jon's son is dead after a body was discovered in the area he had been reported missing from in Georgia.
On Friday, Feb. 6, the Milton Police Department rel...

title: D'Andre Swift Teases That He 'Might Be' Related to Taylor Swift: 'I Can Look Into It' (Exclusive)
description: D'Andre Swift opened up to PEOPLE exclusively about his potential ancestral connection to Taylor Swift ahead of the Super Bowl at Media Row in San Francisco on Thursday, Feb. 5.
content:
The Chicago Bears running back opened up to PEOPLE exclusively about his potential ancestral connection to the pop superstar ahead of the 2026 Super Bowl
Janine Rubenstein is Editor-at-Large at PEOPLE and host of PEOPLE Every Day podcast, a daily dose of breaking news, pop culture and heartwarming human interest stories. Formerly Senior Editor of music content, she's also covered crime, human interest and television news throughout her many years with the brand. Prior to PEOPLE she's written for Essence, The Cape Times newspaper and Los Angeles Magazine among others. On-screen Rubenstein can be found featured on shows like Good Morning America and Entertainment Tonight and she routinely hosts PEOPLE and Entertainment Weekly's star-studded Red Carpet Live specials. Follow the San Francisco native, Black Barbie collector and proud mom of two on Instagram and Twitter @janinerube
D'Andre Swift can play football, but can he sing?
The Chicago Bears running back, 27, jokes about his possible connection to Taylor Swift given their shared last name while speaking with PEOPLE's Janine Rubenstein at the SiriusXM set at Media Row in San Francisco on Thursday, Feb. 5.
"I can look into it," D'Andre tells PEOPLE of giving his ancestry a deep dive to see if the pop superstar, 36, is a long-lost relative of his, but assumes, "I don't think so though, I don't think so."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Despite not being confident that he's on the same family tree as Taylor, D'Andre has hope!
"It might be! It might be. You never know," he says with a laugh.
The Bears running back is appearing in Dairy Queen's "Taylor and Swift" Halftime Feast commercial with New York Jets quarterback Tyrod Taylor.
D'Andre admits "it's cool" to be linked to the 14-time Grammy winner by name, alone, because of the unique opportunities that have come with it, like his latest venture with Dairy Queen.
"She's amazing at what she does. It's cool," he says of Swift.
While the NFL player reveals he has never met the "Fate of Ophelia" singer, he teases, "I'm looking forward to it!"
This isn't the first time D'Andre has been open about the connection. In fact, in 2023, D'Andre played for the Philadelphia Eagles with Jason Kelce, the brother of Taylor's fiancé Travis Kelce.

title: Timothy Busfield Indicted by Grand Jury on 4 Counts of Criminal Sexual Contact with a Child
description: Timothy Busfield was released from the Albuquerque Metropolitan Detention Center in New Mexico on Jan. 20 after surrendering on an arrest warrant that alleged he sexually abused two minors on the set of a TV show.
content:
Busfield was released from the Albuquerque Metropolitan Detention Center in New Mexico on Jan. 20 as he awaits trial for child sex abuse charges
Timothy Busfield has been indicted by a grand jury.
On Friday, Feb. 6, Bernalillo County District Attorney Sam Bregman announced that a Bernalillo County grand jury indicted Busfield, 68, on four charges.
The actor was indicted on four counts of criminal sexual contact of a child, according to Bregman. All four charges are third-degree felonies, according to court documents obtained by PEOPLE.
"As with all criminal proceedings, Mr. Busfield is presumed innocent unless and until proven guilty in a court of law," Bregman stated in the announcement which was shared on his social media account. "This case will proceed through the judicial process and is expected to move forward to trial."
The Special Victims Unit of the Bernalillo County District Attorney’s Office will be prosecutors on the case, per the statement, and Bregman "emphasized that protecting children remains a top priority for his office."
"The Bernalillo County District Attorney’s Office remains committed to doing everything possible to protect children and ensure justice for victims across New Mexico," the announcement concluded.
In a statement from Busfield's civil attorney Stanton "Larry" Stein, he said the "indictment was not unexpected."
"As the saying goes, a grand jury will indict a ham sandwich," the statement continued. "What is deeply concerning is that the District Attorney is choosing to proceed on a case that is fundamentally unsound and cannot be proven at trial. The detention hearing exposed fatal weaknesses in the State’s evidence — gaps that no amount of charging decisions can cure. This prosecution appears driven by something other than the facts or the law. Mr. Busfield will fight these charges at every stage and looks forward to testing the State’s case in open court — where evidence matters — not behind closed doors."
Busfield turned himself in and was booked by authorities on Jan. 13, just four days after the Albuquerque Police Department (APD) issued a warrant for his arrest, alleging that he engaged in unlawful sexual conduct with 11-year-old twin boys. 
The district attorney then filed a motion for pretrial detention against Busfield, which sought to keep him detained until trial. Because of New Mexico’s no-bond detention rule, defendants are otherwise released on recognizance (ROR), with or without conditions.
On Jan. 20, the Field of Dreams actor was released with conditions while he awaits trial, following a two-hour pretrial detention hearing in a San Bernalillo, New Mexico district court. His wife, Melissa Gilbert, was in attendance and was seen crying and whispering, "Thank you, God," when the release was announced.
After being released on his own recognizance, Busfield has been ordered to appear for all his future court dates and is not allowed to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons, consume any alcohol or illegal drugs, have contact with the alleged victims or their families, discuss the case with any witnesses or have unsupervised contact with any minor children. The judge also allowed him to travel, but he will be under the supervision of Pretrial Services in New Mexico.
Busfield spoke out for the first time before surrendering on Jan. 13 in a video obtained by TMZ. "I did not do anything," he said on camera. "They're all lies and I did not do anything to those little boys and I'm gonna fight it. I'm gonna fight it with a great team, and I'm gonna be exonerated, I know I am, because this is all so wrong and all lies."
Moments later, a rep for Gilbert issued a statement on the actress' behalf. "During this period, her focus is on supporting and caring for their very large family, as they navigate this moment," the statement read, in part. "Melissa stands with and supports her husband and will address the public at an appropriate time. We ask that their privacy be respected.”
Stephane Cardinale - Corbis/Corbis via Getty
Officer Marvin Brown, who issued the warrant for Busfield's arrest on Jan. 9, alleged that 11-year-old siblings were the subject of sexual misconduct by Busfield, and one alleged that the incidents began when he was 7 years old.
The warrant, which was obtained by PEOPLE, stated that the victims' parents told Brown that the minors met Busfield on the set of the FOX series The Cleaning Lady, where he served as a director and they were child actors. The television show ran from January 2022 until June 2025.
An investigation into Busfield began in November 2024 when a doctor at the University of New Mexico Hospital (UNMH) alerted police about alleged sexual abuse after the parents took their children to UNMH under advisement from an attorney, per the warrant. Professionals allegedly suggested the boys "were groomed," the warrant said.
Brown said the siblings had not disclosed any sexual contact at this time, but both claimed Busfield “would tickle them on the stomach and legs.” It was later determined that the case did not meet authorities' acceptance criteria.
In October 2025 per the warrant, the victims' mother filed a police report and told Child Protective Services (CPS) that “her children both disclosed that there was sexual abuse by Timothy from around November 2022 to Spring 2024." 
The mother told authorities on Sept. 2, 2025 and Sept. 22, 2025 that her son told his counselor that Busfield inappropriately touched him.
Busfield allegedly told police that the parents were upset their sons had been replaced with a younger actor who auditioned, according to the warrant. Soon after, he got a call from Warner Bros., informing him they were investigating a complaint against him.
A representative at Warner Bros. Television told PEOPLE in a statement, "The health and safety of our cast and crew is always our top priority, especially the safety of minors on our productions. We take all allegations of misconduct very seriously and have systems in place to promptly and thoroughly investigate, and when needed, take appropriate action. [We] have been and will continue to cooperate with law enforcement."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Busfield has also faced prior sexual assault allegations dating back to 1994, according to his warrant. 
In a pretrial detention motion filed on Jan. 14, Busfield faced another accusation of sexual abuse. "Another victim's father," Colin Swift, reported to law enforcement on Jan. 13 that Busfield allegedly had sexually abused Swift's daughter "several years ago" in Sacramento, Calif., per the motion.
Busfield’s civil attorney Larry Stein told PEOPLE in a statement that the allegations "were never challenged, they were never proved, and they’re 25 years old."
If you suspect child abuse, call the Childhelp National Child Abuse Hotline at 1-800-4-A-Child or 1-800-422-4453, or go to www.childhelp.org. All calls are toll-free and confidential. The hotline is available 24/7 in more than 170 languages.

On Friday, Feb. 6, Bernalillo County District Attorne...

title: 5 Lane Bryant Employees Inexplicably Killed in Illinois Store Subject of Documentary 18 Years Later, as $100,000 Reward Remains
description: Six women were tied up and shot in the back of the Lane Bryant store in Tinley Park, Ill., on Feb. 2, 2008. 18 years later, family and friends hope for answers as the search for the suspect continues, with a $100,000 reward on the table.
content:
The crime continues to leave a mark on the Tinley Park community, though the store itself was repurposed in 2013 after sitting vacant for 6 years
Zbigniew Bzdak/Chicago Tribune/Tribune News Service via Getty
Family members of the victims of the Lane Bryant murders are continuing to look for answers.
On Feb. 2, 2008, an unknown suspect entered a Lane Bryant location in Tinley Park, Ill., where four employees were on shift, tending to two customers. The assailant, posing as a delivery driver, entered the store and tied up the six women inside.
Rhoda McFarland, 42; Connie Woolfolk, 37; Jennifer Bishop, 34; Carrie Chiuso, 33; Sarah Szafranski, 22, were all shot execution style and died of their injuries. The sixth woman shot, a part-time employee at the store who survived her injuries, has never been publicly identified by police. One of the women was also sexually assaulted by the suspect, though police have never revealed which of the victims was involved.
The surviving victim was able to relay details to police about the suspect's appearance, while his voice can be heard on a 911 call reporting the incident.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.  
The horrific crime, which changed countless lives that day, is the subject of an upcoming documentary by former America's Most Wanted producer Charlie Minn.
“The Tinley Park 5” is slated to debut Feb. 13 in a number of local theaters in the area. Minn told WBEZ Chicago that he's hoping "to start some chatter here."
"The whole point is to stir up enough attention, raise enough awareness, to solve the case... This case has faded, people are busy, they move on. I hope people see this and become as angry as I am about what happened."
Also hopeful is Mike Hudek, brother of Carrie Chiuso, who continues to want answers for his family.
"I kind of had to forgive and let that go right after it happened, because I was going down that rabbit hole of why and what if and what could have been done, you can't undo what happened," Hudek told CBS News Chicago.
"This individual is not going to be caught until somebody speaks up or identifies who he is. I mean, he's somebody's son, grandson, nephew... whatever the case may be, somebody's aware of who this individual is."
Hudek likes to remember his sister for the life she lived rather than the tragic manner in which it came to an end.
"We remember her in other ways. I mean, this is, of course, a tragic event, and we will certainly have a toast tonight in her honor around the dinner table," he said.
While the case remains unsolved, Tinley Park police ensure the investigation is still ongoing.
"This investigation has never stopped,” Police Chief Tom Tilton told ABC7 Chicago. “Our detectives and partners continue to evaluate leads, review evidence and apply available investigative and forensic tools as they evolve. This work occurs every day.”

title: Hailee Steinfeld Reveals Simple Marriage Rules She Has with Husband Josh Allen
description: Hailee Steinfeld shared the simple rules she and husband Josh Allen, quarterback for the NFL's Buffalo Bills, stick to in order to maintain their relationship with busy work schedules.
content:
The actress and her NFL quarterback husband married in May 2025, and they announced they were expecting in December
Hailee Steinfeld and husband Josh Allen follow a few simple rules to stay present with each other in their marriage.
The Sinners actress, 29, responded to a question from a follower of her newsletter Beau Society about how she maintains "an intentional relationship while both of you are so busy" in the Friday, Feb. 6 edition of the newsletter.
"I love this question. There’s an easy answer in my brain. I don’t want it to seem cliché, but we focus on being truly present with each other," she wrote.
"More specifically, we’re big on weekly date nights and going no-phones for an hour at the end of the day."
The actress-singer, who married Allen in May 2025, announced she was pregnant with their first child in December.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Allen, Buffalo's quarterback, led the Bills to a 27-24 win in the NFL playoffs' first round on Jan. 11 on the road against the Jacksonville Jaguars the same day Steinfeld appeared separately in Los Angeles to attend the Golden Globe Awards. 
Her film Sinners went on to break a record for the most Oscar nominations for a single movie — 16 total — on Jan. 22.
Allen took an opportunity to publicly share his affection for Steinfeld after he won that Jan. 11 playoff game. He shared a photo of Steinfeld on the red carpet at the Globes in chic maternity style to his Instagram Stories that night and left the emojis "🤤😍," in a caption.

Earl Gibson III/2026GG/Penske Media via Getty; Timothy T Ludwig/Getty 
Allen announced Jan. 29 that he underwent surgery on a broken bone in his right foot to repair an injury he suffered in Week 16 of the NFL season. 

The couple's busy winter will wrap up in March, with Steinfeld expected to appear with Sinners' cast and crew at the Actor Awards (formerly SAG Awards) on March 1 and at the 98th Academy Awards on March 15. Steinfeld also introduced a paid subscription tier to her newsletter titled MORE BS on Feb. 3, which fans of hers can sign up for now.
