title: Stephen Colbert Surprises Wife Evie McGee Colbert with a $250,000 Tiffany Necklace for Valentine's Day
description: Stephen Colbert had a special Valentine's Day surprise lined up for his wife, Evie McGee Colbert. The Late Show host featured his wife on the show on Feb. 5, and presented her with a stunning Tiffany necklace — with a catch.
content:
'Who'd you have to rob to pay for this?' Evie joked
Mike Coppola/Getty; The Late Show with Stephen Colbert
Diamonds are the Colberts' best friends!
Stephen Colbert, 61, demonstrated his impeccable taste in jewels on the Thursday, Feb. 5 episode of The Late Show when he invited his wife, Evie McGee Colbert, to join him on air as part of his comedic "First Drafts" segment. Stephen — who has been married to the actress for more than three decades — had a surprise in store for Evie: a tell-tale Tiffany Blue box.
"Of course it wouldn't be Valentine's Day," Stephen began, already shouting over building applause, "without my wife, Evie!"
Cheers erupted as Evie, clad in a ruched pink floral dress, walked on stage, and the actress greeted her husband with a kiss before waving to the crowd.
Even though there were still nine days until Valentine's Day, Stephen apparently couldn't wait another second to present Evie with a large, square Tiffany box — and Evie's eyes widened at the sight of it. The pair playfully squabbled about who got to open the gift, and ultimately Stephen untied the bow and undid the package to reveal a stunning Tiffany & Co. necklace.
The Late Show with Stephen Colbert
"This is real. This is from Tiffany," Stephen said, as he unveiled the sparkling necklace, a bold statement piece featuring unique chain links featuring tons of pave diamonds.
"Holy s***!" Evie gasped as she grew giddy with joy. "Can I touch it?" she asked, though Stephen did her one better as he stood to drape the necklace around her. "Happy Valentine's Day," he added as Evie beamed.
"Who'd you have to rob to pay for this?" Evie joked. She then mused aloud if he (or she) did something wrong, speculating that the necklace may have been some sort of apology gift.
Once Stephen clarified that no, he didn't do anything wrong and no, it wasn't an extra sparkly apology, he revealed the catch: the necklace is a loan from Tiffany, which sent a set of "armed guards" to protect the necklace for the seven minutes it hung around Evie's neck (or "however long the joke lasts," Stephen added).
Evie let out a huge laugh as Stephen said, "That's, like, a quarter of a million-dollar necklace," His wife immediately joked, "Take it off!"
Stephen then made light of his show's soon-approaching end, which parent company CBS decided to conclude in May 2026 as a "purely financial decision," per its announcement in July 2025.
"I was going to charge [the necklace] to CBS, but they seem a little tight on cash right now," Stephen joked, drawing raucous laughter from the audience.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Later in the segment, Stephen and Evie — who tied the knot in October 1993 and have since welcomed three children together — read off the list of qualities that the actress's 12-year-old self once considered to make the "perfect guy."
Her ideal man would have a "good personality" and be a person with humor, generosity, kindness. He should also be "daring" and "fun-loving" — and last but not least, Evie once wrote, he should be an "all-out man."
To that, Stephen dramatically whipped off his glasses, stared into the camera and said, "I'm an all-in man."

title: 5 Super Bowl WAGs Reveal Their Secrets to the Perfect Game Day Outfit (Exclusive)
description: Five NFL WAGs with partners playing in the 2026 Super Bowl are opening up about their perfect game day outfits. Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots will face off in the championship game on Sunday, Feb. 8 at Levi's Stadium.
content:
The Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots will face off in the championship game on Sunday, Feb. 8 at Levi's Stadium
Courtesy of Nijeria McClain; Courtesy of Ahna Kreitinger; Courtesy of Mackenzie Mae Cole
As the Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots practice ahead of the 2026 Super Bowl, the players' wives, girlfriends and fiancés are laying out their own game plans for championship-worthy outfits.
Ahead of the big game on Sunday, Feb. 8, at Levi's Stadium, the WAGs shared with PEOPLE all that goes into their unique sideline style. While some prefer to let their team spirit sing by backdropping merch on a simple, solid pair of jeans, others opt wear their heart on their sleeves — literally — with custom garments emblazoned with their significant other's number or name.
Find out how five women of the NFL calculate the perfect game day outfit — and how they'll be bringing fashion to the Super Bowl this year.
Seattle skies tend to skew gloomy, but Mackenzie Mae Cole tells PEOPLE the weather doesn't truly inhibit her plans when dressing up to watch her fiancé, Seahawks wide receiver Jake Bobo, take the field.
Cole has an easy "go-to" outfit formula, usually donning a "good pair of jeans," some boots and a piece of Seahawks merch to get into the spirit, whether that's a team hat, jacket or top.
"I've done some different stuff during playoffs, but I feel like I keep it pretty simple," she says. "Some of the girls on our team can throw together the coolest jackets and stuff like that. I'm just not really crafty, so I play it pretty simple, but the game days are really long, so comfort is huge."

Devon Witherspoon's girlfriend Nijeria McClain is all about wearing custom-made clothes when she's watching football. Her bespoke Seattle Seahawks merch ranges in style, but she always finds a way to shout out her high school sweetheart.
"You can go simple and you can go bold, but as long as there's a cute little number or name. To me, that's what I look for: the details," she tells PEOPLE. "I think the customization definitely makes the fit."
Ahna Kreitinger, the soon-to-be wife of Seahawks safety Ty Okada, also swears by the statement piece rule when it comes to outfit planning. "And if you're big balling, and hell, and you have three standout objects, great," she adds.
Once she knew her fiancé would be making his Super Bowl debut this year, Kreitinger says she didn't waste any time placing an order for her look's standout centerpiece. But after a back-and-forth with customer support, she learned it wouldn't arrive on time for her to wear to Levi's Stadium.
"I found a plan B, and she's supposed to arrive today, and I leave today," she tells PEOPLE just days before the NFL championship. "So I'm sitting here — how am I supposed to be productive when I have clothes in the air right now trying to make it to me?"
Still, Kreitinger is excited to bring out a new side of her wardrobe on the big day.
"The star of my show for the Super Bowl is a necktie, which is out of my comfort zone," she explains. "I haven't leaned into the masculine side of things in my game day outfits, but I'm down for a risk."

Seahawks star Chris Stoll's wife, Maddie Stoll, is a self-proclaimed fashion lover, so it comes as no surprise that she says outfits are the first thing on her mind come game day.
"I always try to pick one item that is the statement and then build from there," she says. "For the NFC Championship, my brother and sister ... got me this custom jacket [for Christmas], so I took that and built around it."
Crucially, she notes that the best sideline style comes from a place of authenticity. "Dress because you love it. Dress because this is what you wanted to do," she says. "Fashion is so individualistic and it can express so many things, but the main thing is that you like what you're wearing."
Emily Carlson has cheered on her fiancé Nick Kallerup since his collegiate football years, when they were both students at the University of Minnesota. Back then, the game day style stakes were slightly lower, since pretty much anything she wore would be shrouded by a big winter coat.
Kallerup's rookie season with the Seattle Seahawks hasn't just led to his first Super Bowl — it's also allowed Carlson to embrace football-friendly fashion. She tells PEOPLE she pulled plenty of inspiration from WAGs she followed on social media and leaned into some more bespoke options to spruce up her looks.
"There's a huge pool of very talented people, either through Etsy or through Instagram, that make these amazing pieces," she explains. "My thing going into it was like, 'Okay, I want to find a person and then just order a bunch of stuff and then figure out how I'm using it throughout the season.' So that's kind of what I did."
She adds, "What I've tried to do — and I haven't done an amazing job — but I don't want to buy a lot of things that I'm only wearing one time and then never wearing it again. So I'm hoping we're with the Seahawks for a long time."

title: Seahawks Dancers Coach Gives an Inside Look Into Their Rigorous Super Bowl Prep (Exclusive)
description: Jacqueline Schneider is an assistant sideline coach for the Seattle Seahawks Dancers, who danced with the Seahawks Dancers the last time they played the Patriots in the Super Bowl. She tells PEOPLE about what goes into getting a cheer squad Super Bowl ready.
content:
Jacqueline Schneider is an assistant sideline coach for the Seattle Seahawks Dancers and she tells PEOPLE about what goes into getting a cheer squad Super Bowl ready
Carlos Avila Gonzalez/San Francisco Chronicle via Getty 
While all eyes are on the two teams set to appear in the 2026 Super Bowl on Sunday, Feb. 8, there are countless other individuals who have been preparing for weeks to support the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots in Santa Clara, Calif.

Aside from the family members and support staff accompanying the teams to the Super Bowl, the Seattle Seahawks Dancers will also be on the sidelines.

According to Jacqueline Schneider, who is an assistant sideline coach for the Seahawks Dancers and was a dancer herself for the Seahawks at two previous Super Bowls, prepping to get the dancers Super Bowl sideline ready can be quite similar to preparing for a regular game.

"You would expect it to have changed over the last 12 years," Schneider, who performed at both Super Bowls in 2024 and 2015. "But as far as the dancers and cheerleaders' commitment on game day, it's very similar to years past."
However, the Super Bowl is not just a regular game, which means that there are a few things that dancers and squad management need to keep an eye out for.

Read along below to find out about some of the little-known things that go into getting a cheer squad performance ready for football's biggest game.

Since the final two teams for the Super Bowl depend on the outcome of each game leading up to it, dancers at the Super Bowl don't know they're going until the final championship game, barely two weeks before it takes place.
"It prolonged their season now that we're in postseason," Schneider explains. "So [the dancers] have been practicing every single week since May."

"They had I think a couple weeks off here and there, but I mean they've been working so hard this season and then they've been at practice all month. They've had rehearsals for the Super Bowl because the off-season is week by week. So we're just like, 'OK we do, I guess we have practice again next week,'" Schneider says.

The dancers also have extra practices for their additional media appearances throughout the Super Bowl festivities.

Matthew Huang/Icon Sportswire via Getty
According to Schneider, one thing that is different about the way the Super Bowl is structured for dancers and cheer squads is where the performers are stationed throughout the stadium.

"Typically at home, we're spread out between all four corners of the field," Schneider explains, sharing how the dancers often do multiple performances in each end zone, and are stationed around all four corners of the field during play.

At the Super Bowl, however, the opposing team's spirit squads are split up on each sideline, and each team gets to perform a routine in the end zone during one of the quarter changes.
While dancers might be used to taking to the field during the halftime show on their home turf, the Super Bowl is quite literally a whole different ball game.

Instead of performances by representatives from each NFL team, as many have during regular-season games, the Super Bowl halftime show can almost be classified as its own event.

This year, Bad Bunny will take to the stage to headline the 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show.
“What I'm feeling goes beyond myself," Bad Bunny said in a previous press release about his performance. "It's for those who came before me and ran countless yards so I could come in and score a touchdown… this is for my people, my culture, and our history. Ve y dile a tu abuela, que seremos el HALFTIME SHOW DEL SUPER BOWL.”

Of regular halftime shows, Schneider says, "If we have a really big halftime show, then we'll get there a little bit earlier to extend our pregame rehearsal."

"So the dancers arrive, they start stretching, they start rehearsing in the locker room, and then we take them out on the field for pregame practice," she continues. "And so they're running all of their routines, all of their sidelines, fillers or what we call them and their feature routines and then any sort of halftime performance if there is one."

In the weeks leading up to the Super Bowl, the dancers have had extra practices not only for their Super Bowl performances, but for all of the appearances preceding the big day.

"They have a countless media appearances this week, starting the past Monday. And then dance performances, community events and of course practice. We'll have practice again in San Francisco for the Super Bowl on Sunday," Schneider reveals.

"Prep in the last couple of weeks has been Courtney, our director, handling a lot of the PR and media requests because of, and that goes from just local up into everything going on in San Francisco," Schneider tells PEOPLE of her side of things.

"When you've made it this far in the game, there's a huge uptick in requests. And so managing all of that as well as our dancers, putting in the extra time to do that on top of their full-time jobs and their professional lives and personal lives — t's been a whirlwind, I think, for everyone, but in the best way," she adds.

Carlos Avila Gonzalez/San Francisco Chronicle via Getty

title: Idiotka Director Teases Saweetie's Role with Julia Fox in New Comedy: She's 'a Natural' (Exclusive)
description: Nastasya Popov, the director behind Saweetie and Julia Fox's new movie 'Idiotka,' tells PEOPLE the rapper is "a natural" on a film set. 'Idiotka' stars Anna Baryshnikov as a woman named Margarita, who enters a fashion reality competition in an attempt to prevent her family from losing their home in L.A.
content:
'Idiotka' stars Saweetie and Julia Fox as judges on a fictional fashion reality competition series
The Idiotka director is singing her cast's praises.
Writer-director Nastasya Popov told PEOPLE at the film's Thursday, Feb. 5 premiere in New York City that rapper Saweetie, 32, fit right in on the set of the comedy. The film follows a strapped-for-cash fashion designer (Anna Baryshnikov) who enters a fashion reality show competition to try and prevent her family from losing their L.A. apartment.

"I think that watching how funny [Benito Skinner is], like, I never got to watch Benito Skinner work until he was on set with me. Just seeing his improv and his comedy is just truly one-of-a-kind and once-in-a-generation," Popov says, when asked who on the cast surprised her with their performances during filming.
"He was making us all cry with laughter. Saweetie was also great. She hasn't acted a ton, but she was a natural," adds Popov.

"And, of course, Julia Fox is just, like, Julia Fox!" Popov adds, with a laugh. "They're so down to earth. I'm lucky that they were all so humble and easy to work with and made my job really easy. So it was surreal but also incredible."
Skinner, 32, Saweetie and Fox, 36, play judges in the movie's fictional fashion reality competition, depicted as similar to Project Runway or America's Next Top Model. 
"It was kind of the perfect role for me at the time," Fox tells PEOPLE on the red carpet. "I really got to have an alter ego and just play this really out. I guess I am kind of outrageous, but even more to alter [myself]."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Saweetie made her acting debut in 2021 when she appeared in three episodes of the series Grown-ish. She also made an appearance on a 2023 episode of the series Bel-Air as herself and similarly lent her voice for a cameo as herself in a 2024 episode of the HBO Max series Velma.

A synopsis for Idiotka teases that Baryshnikov, 33, portrays "disgraced fashion designer with a dangerously low credit score, Margarita, [who] enters a reality show with a six-figure cash prize to save her babushka’s West Hollywood apartment."
"But as the competition intensifies, slick producer Nicol (Camila Mendes) pushes her to spin her family’s struggle into spectacle, forcing Margarita to decide whether to play along or take control of her own narrative, one unhinged look at a time," the synopsis adds.

Idiotka is in select theaters Feb. 27.

title: Margot Robbie Reveals She Wasn’t Always Going to Play the Lead in Wuthering Heights
description: Margot Robbie revealed how she got a leading role in the upcoming film adaptation of ‘Wuthering Heights’ during an appearance on ‘The Graham Norton Show.’ The actress said she ‘always’ wanted to star in a movie by filmmaker Emerald Fennell.
content:
The actress spoke about starring as Catherine Earnshaw in ‘Wuthering Heights’ ahead of its Feb. 13 release
PA Images / Alamy Stock Photo; Warner Bros.
Margot Robbie is still in disbelief that she scooped a leading role in the upcoming Wuthering Heights movie.
The actress, 35, spoke candidly about her role in the film adaptation of Emily Brontë’s 1847 gothic novel of the same name during an appearance on The Graham Norton Show on Friday, Feb. 6. She appeared on the chat show hosted by Norton, alongside her costar Jacob Elordi.
It is not yet known if director Emerald Fennell’s 2026 adaptation will stay true to the original story.
“I wasn’t always going to be in it. I was thrilled to be the producer, but at some point, we were talking about Cathy, and I decided to throw my hat into the ring,” said Robbie, referring to the female lead character, Catherine Earnshaw.
Robbie continued, “I’ve always wanted to be one of Emerald’s actors and fortunately, she felt the same way. It worked out wonderfully.”
Filmmaker Fennell is best known for projects such as Saltburn and Promising Young Woman. 
In Wuthering Heights, she cast Elordi, 28, as Heathcliff, an orphan who forms an intense bond with the daughter of the wealthy family he’s taken in by, Catherine. The novel focuses on their doomed romance, class divide and the impact on their families.
“Emerald loves the book and she really focused on the feeling it gave her when she first read it at 14,” said Robbie. “She channels that raw emotional experience so it’s an interpretation rather than an adaptation. 
“In my opinion, it is one of the greatest love stories of all time and it has a great cast and incredible actors. It’s a great film,” she added.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Araya Doheny/Variety via Getty 
While Robbie and Elordi star as Catherine and Heathcliff, the rest of the Wuthering Heights cast includes Hong Chau, Alison Oliver, Shazad Latif, Martin Clunes and Ewan Mitchell.
Charlotte Mellington and Adolescence's Owen Cooper play young Catherine and Heathcliff.
Elordi, who recently received an Oscar nomination for Frankenstein, confessed his role in the movie came as a surprise. 
Speaking on The Graham Norton Show, Elordi said, “I was traveling when I got a text message from [Fennell] saying, ‘Do you want to be Heathcliff?’ and I wrote, ‘Yeah.’ ” 
Wuthering Heights is set to be released ahead of Valentine’s Day on Friday, Feb. 13. 
The Graham Norton Show airs on BBC One and iPlayer, Friday, Feb. 6 at 10:40 p.m. GMT.

'The Fourth Wall' gives a never-before-seen look into the PEOPLE newsroom. New episodes air on the PEOPLE App
The people of PEOPLE are bringing you behind the scenes on The Fourth Wall.
Our brand-new short-form reality series is your exclusive peek behind the curtain of PEOPLE's newsroom, detailing the process behind the biggest cover stories like our World's Most Beautiful cover with Demi Moore and our Sexiest Man Alive issue with Jonathan Bailey.
New episodes of The Fourth Wall premiere on The PEOPLE App, which is now available for download on the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store for Android users.
Here, catch up on The Fourth Wall with PEOPLE by binge-watching all the episodes to date — and check out the newest episodes only in the app. (Here's the newest episode, if you haven't seen it yet!)

title: 19 Vintage Photos from the Olympics — from Jesse Owens' Historic Feat to Michael Phelps' Record-Breaking Streak
description: From Jesse Owens to Nadia Comǎneci to Kristi Yamaguchi, Michael Phelps and more, see some of the most epic moments from the Olympic Games through the years
content:
From 1936 to 2016 see some of the most epic moments from the Olympic Games through the years
Wally McNamee/CORBIS/Corbis via Getty; Gary M Prior/Allsport; MARTIN BUREAU/AFP via Getty
The modern Winter and Summer Olympics give athletes around the world the chance to bring their best feet forward.
Dating all the way back to 1896, participating nations send their most qualified track stars, gymnasts, figure skaters, swimmers, tennis players and more to vie for their country's glory on the world stage. So, naturally, the Olympics have produced some of the most nail-biting, heartwarming and controversial moments of all time.
As we gear up for the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics kicking off today, (live coverage will begin at 2 p.m. EST, with the primetime event starting at 8 p.m. on NBC and Peacock), check out some vintage photos from past Games below.
Jesse Owens of Team USA was pictured in action during the men's 200m at the 1936 Summer Olympic Games held in Berlin. Owens would go on to win a total of four gold medals that year, a feat that refuted Hitler's ideology that Black people were inferior.
Eddie Crook, Muhammad Ali (then Cassius Clay) and Skeeter McClure hang out with their gold medals on display while in the Olympic Village in 1960, Rome.
Dorothy Hyman, Wilma Rudolph and Giuseppina Leone shake hands while standing on the podium at the 1960 Olympics.
U.S. swimmer Mark Spitz proudly displays the five gold medals he won in the 1972 Summer Olympics. Winning seven gold medals total, he was the most decorated athlete at the 1972 games in Munich.
Wally McNamee/CORBIS/Corbis via Getty
Romanian gymnast Nadia Comǎneci stood victorious on the podium with one of the three gold medals she won at the Montreal Olympics in 1976. At just 14-years-old, Comǎneci was the first gymnast in history to get a perfect score for her routine.
Kristi Yamaguchi of Team U.S.A. became the first Asian-American to win an Olympic Gold Medal during the France Olympics in 1992.
John W. McDonough /Sports Illustrated via Getty 
The 1992 Dream Team members Scottie Pippen, Michael Jordan, Clyde Drexler, and Karl Malone got their flowers after winning the Men's Gold Medal Game vs Croatia at the Spain Olympics in 1992.
Nigeria's Olympic soccer team posed in their green and white after beating out Argentina for the gold at the 1996 Summer Olympics.
France's Surya Bonaly stunned the judges during her performance in the women's Olympic figure skating competition in Nagano, 1998. After years of feeling underrated, Bonaly made waves at the 1998 Olympics after she performed an illegal backflip in protest.
Team U.S.A.'s Venus and Serena Williams pose with their gold after winning the Women's Doubles Tennis Final at the 2000 Olympic Games in Australia. They would win together again in 2008 and 2012.
Shaun White and his family are ecstatic as they celebrate his winning the gold medal in the Men's Halfpipe finals in Italy, 2006.
Michael Phelps triumphantly surfaced from the water after winning the men's 100m butterfly swimming final, which earned him a seventh gold medal and tied Mark Spitz's 1972 record. He would add another and officially set the record for most wins in a single Olympics.
Phelps, along with teammates Brendan Hansen, Jason Lezak and Aaron Piersol showed off their fresh bling.
The gap wasn't even close between Usain Bolt and his competitors, as the famed Jamaican track star raced to victory during the 2008 Beijing Olympics.
Julia Mancuso and Lindsey Vonn of the United States celebrate with Austria's Elisabeth Görgl during the flower ceremony for the Alpine Skiing Ladies Downhill during the Vancouver 2010 Winter Olympics.
Meryl Davis and Charlie White of the United States compete in the Figure Skating Team Ice Dance at the Sochi 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi. They would become the first American team to win Olympic gold in ice dance.
Joe Scarnici/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty
Tongan flag bearer Pita Taufatofua had the internet buzzing during the opening ceremony in 2016, so naturally, Today's Hoda Kotb had to make sure he is oiled up perfectly for their segment.
Stuart Franklin - FIFA/FIFA via Getty
Neymar Jr. of Brazil and his teammates take a bite of the gold after besting Germany in Rio, 2016.
Simone Biles began her reign at the 2016 Olympics, pictured here in perfect form as she competes on the floor during the Artistic Gymnastics Women's Team Final. She would win five medals that year — four gold, one bronze — and set the record for most gold medals won in women's gymnastics in a single Olympics.

title: Nick Jonas Reveals How a Fan Helped Him Teach Daughter Malti, 4, About Diabetes: 'I Was Really Blown Away' (Exclusive)
description: Musician Nick Jonas tells PEOPLE about creating his new album 'Sunday Best' amid the Jonas Brothers’ busy tour schedule and offering fans insight into his personal life.
content:
Jonas tells PEOPLE about creating his new album 'Sunday Best' amid the Jonas Brothers’ busy tour schedule and offering fans insight into his personal life
Nick Jonas’ latest body of work is his most vulnerable yet.
The “Gut Punch” singer, 33, released his new solo album, Sunday Best, on Friday, Feb. 6. The project features insights into Jonas’ personal life both in its songs and cover image, a photo of him looking in the bathroom mirror with his Dexcom G7 continuous glucose monitor visible on his arm and artwork featuring handprints that appear to be from him, his wife Priyanka Chopra and their daughter Malti Marie, 4.
Over the project’s 11 songs, Jonas bares his soul through lyrics about his past and present experiences as a musician, husband and father: learning about his type 1 diabetes diagnosis, dealing with self-criticism, playing games with Malti and more. The album’s personal nature is further illustrated by its lack of collaborations — aside from one, “The Greatest,” with the Jonas Brothers.
Sonically, Sunday Best finds Jonas exploring his soulful side with live instrumentation and choir-like background vocals — which he’s brought to life at several pop-up preview shows, including a full live premiere of the album at New York City’s Irving Plaza on Thursday, Feb. 5.
Jonas recently sat down with PEOPLE to discuss creating Sunday Best amid the Jonas Brothers’ busy tour schedule, offering fans insight into his life, featuring his continuous glucose monitor on the album’s cover, his journey with diabetes and how he’s teaching Malti about the disease.
PEOPLE: Over the past two years you have done two tours, an album and a movie with the Jonas Brothers, plus The Last Five Years on Broadway. And I believe you worked on another couple of films in that time in addition to being a father. How did you find time to not only make this album, but gather the inspiration for new solo music?
Nick Jonas: We basically had a week break during the most recent Brothers tour. When we're on the road, we're actually most inspired to get out and write new music because you're on stage seeing how these songs are impacting people's lives. It's amazing to see music become a part of the fabric of people's lives, and so you just want to make more.
During that window, I had been really inspired by a lot of these life experiences I'd had over the last year, coming to New York, setting up life here with my family while I was doing the Broadway show, and then we ended up staying because it was more convenient just based on the tour routing and everything else. Our life got really small and simple, and it was just the time I had with my wife and my daughter, some of these experiences in the city, and then just things I'd been wanting to write about for a long time that I was finally able to put pen to paper on.
A big piece of that was finding the right collaborators. I got to work with JP Saxe on a lot of this record, who I met by way of seeing a video he had posted that really hit me where he mentioned that he would basically have to sell 20,000 more tickets or he'd have to cancel this tour. I was taken aback by his honesty and his vulnerability and messaged him, and then he ended up being a special guest on our Toronto show. I asked him if he wanted to come to this writing camp, and thankfully he said yes. And so finding those missing pieces and putting it all together was really the unlock.
The Sunday Best cover artwork showcases very simply two very important parts of your personal life, the Dexcom G7 continuous glucose monitor on your arm and the three handprints on the wall that look like they came from you, your wife Priyanka and daughter Malti. How did you decide on this album artwork and include those specific elements?
I really wanted the album cover to feel like you're looking into my life. I always had this idea of looking in the mirror and just the questions we all ask ourselves every day — am I being the best version of myself today? Am I being hard on myself? Am I being nice?
All that is really represented in the lyrics of “Gut Punch,” but there's other elements in there that were really important to me, the handprints being one. I am a husband and a father now, and it's a huge part of where I draw inspiration from, so that was important to include. And then it just happened that I was obviously wearing the Dexcom as I do every day. There was never a conversation about not having it in there just because it's another aspect of who I am. It's part of the DNA of my life and something that, I think, gives the person looking at this image a better idea of who I am.
I'm really glad it's there. It also continues to create awareness about something that is really revolutionary and done a ton to improve my life and so many other people's lives living with diabetes.
You've lived with type 1 diabetes since you were 13. But I feel like a lot of fans, myself included, learned around the A Little Bit Longer album when you started writing about it. You had learned to manage the disease with health technology by then, but I remember so many young fans at the time not knowing much about diabetes and thinking that you remained in critical condition. Did you feel that reaction at the time, and what did you make of it?
The conversation around awareness has always been one that's evolving every day. And the things that people know about diabetes or don't, are really revealing of the work that still needs to be done. I think back then there was just a lack of awareness, people thinking that it was critical and that it stays that way.
Diabetes is a manageable disease. However, without proper management, it can be really dangerous or even potentially fatal. So it's important to keep that in mind as we talk about the fact that it is manageable, and that there's a way to live a big and healthy, and wonderful life with it, but there are still some people globally that don't have access to life preserving and saving medication, and other technology.
Did you realize at a certain point, "We have a lot of young listeners, and I want to inform them about diabetes and not just leave them feeling scared?"
From the moment I was released from the hospital, I was determined to get a real grip on how to manage the disease and live with it every day. But then once I felt comfortable, which was pretty soon after that, to be able to use this, at the time, fairly small platform, but to use whatever platform I had to be able to speak about it and try to encourage others going through an experience like it or directly related to diabetes.
When I was in the hospital, there was nobody that I could look at and say, "Oh, they're living with diabetes. They're doing just fine." It became important for me to be a part of that conversation, and hopefully the next 13-year-old kid sitting in the hospital room feeling discouraged and alone, and having a tough time with it would feel some encouragement.
And you're not the only one speaking about it now. Role Model has been open about his experience with type 1 diabetes, and fans have seen his continuous glucose monitor.
Yeah, it's been very exciting to see others come out and speak about their journey. It's a big, beautiful community with lots of interesting stories, and we can all pull inspiration and encouragement from each other. Role Model sharing his story is just amazing, and I'm happy for his success, and also he seems to be in great health, which is most important.
As your daughter, Malti, gets older, have you thought about how you'll discuss diabetes with her? Has she noticed your continuous glucose monitor?
Yeah, of course. She's seen the glucose monitor and my insulin pump. There was actually a fan on the tour who gifted me a diabetes coloring book. Basically, it's an educational coloring book for young diabetics, but also for others to learn about not just the disease, but some of the things that someone might see at that age and not fully understand yet, but it just helped start the conversation.
I was really blown away by that, and I gave that to her to color, and she made the connections of the insulin pump or the CGM [continuous glucose monitor]. We're always thinking it's best just to be honest and transparent, and find a way to articulate it so she has the information and the facts, and is surrounded by love and care in the way that we communicate so that there's nothing that's ever scary or that might stress her out.
It's a normal thing, and it's just something Dad lives with, and that's what it is.
There's also a song on the album in your daughter's honor, “Princesses.” Can you tell me the story behind that song?
My daughter loves princesses and loves to play princesses. The day we wrote that song, I'd come in. Me, JP Saxe and [Jeff “Gitty” Gitelman] were writing a different song. And then basically I went to the bathroom, came back and was like, "Wait, can we just try something and just take a swing and see?" I didn't know if it was something they would connect with, but I said, “I have this title, ‘Princesses,’” and they both stood up straight and were like, "Yes, let's do that."
The verses are just speaking about how I see her and how she sees the world, and the chorus is that desire to just play princesses and stay stuck in that moment with her forever if I could.

title: Ellen DeGeneres and Portia de Rossi Share Dispatch from California Following Decision to Split Time Between U.S. and U.K.
description: On Friday, Feb. 6, Ellen DeGeneres shared a video on social media of the couple dancing in the garden to celebrate DeGeneres' 68th birthday. The post comes shortly after PEOPLE confirmed they purchased a new home base in Montecito in addition to their Cotswolds farmhouse in the U.K.
content:
The couple celebrated DeGeneres' 68th birthday shortly after PEOPLE confirmed they purchased a new home base in Montecito in addition to their Cotswolds farmhouse
Dave Benett/Getty; Ellen DeGeneres/Instagram
Ellen DeGeneres and Portia de Rossi are celebrating the former talk show host’s 68th birthday by dancing in a gorgeous garden.
On Friday, Feb. 6, DeGeneres took to social media to share a new clip of the couple lip syncing to BT Express’ “Do It (Til You’re Satisfied).” In the video, DeGeneres wears a rainbow-colored suit jacket, large sunglasses with pink frames, and a hat in the shape of a birthday cake.
Meanwhile, the Arrested Development alum, 53, wears a white cowboy hat and sunglasses with seashells and a starfish while playing the tambourine, all set against a lush backdrop of pristine landscaping and palm trees.
“6-7 is out. 6-8 is in,” the comedian writes in her caption, referencing the viral phrase.

The post comes shortly after PEOPLE confirmed that Degeneres had purchased a new Southern California property.
“She’s not moving back to the U.S. but will continue to split her time between both the U.K. and Montecito,” an insider previously told PEOPLE. 

The pair had relocated to the rural Cotswolds area of south central England in November 2024, and shared dispatches of their life there living on a farm with their animals on social media.
When the couple first relocated abroad, they lived in a home that they purchased in the spring of 2024. The Wall Street Journal reported they only lived there for a month before a series of extensive renovations. DeGeneres and de Rossi later relisted the home for $30 million in July 2024. The stars subsequently moved into another property better suited for de Rossi’s horses. 

Locals who used to see the couple around their Cotswolds estate regularly told PEOPLE they haven’t seen DeGeneres “in ages,” and a local pub source says she hasn’t been in for “several months.”
Another source added that DeGeneres was often spotted out in their village over the summer, but hasn’t been seen since. “She always looked friendly but nobody ever approached her and it was just another celeb to them.” 
The Cotswolds is home to numerous A-list stars such as the Beckhams, model Kate Moss and actor Hugh Grant. 
Back in July 2025, DeGeneres confirmed to the BBC that she and her wife permanently moved to England because Donald Trump was re-elected as president in 2024. She added that de Rossi was “living her dream" as an avid horse lover in the English countryside. 
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
DeGeneres is known to be an avid home renovator and house flipper, having purchased at least 34 homes around California since the mid-2000s, including properties in Los Angeles, Beverly Hills and Montecito.

Ellen DeGeneres and Portia de Rossi are ce...

title: Robert Irwin Shares Sweet Gesture He 'Always' Does for Niece Grace, 4, When He Travels (Exclusive)
description: Robert Irwin tells PEOPLE the sweet gesture he "always" does for his niece Grace, 4, when he travels.
content:
Robert's sister Bindi Irwin shares her daughter Grace, 4, with husband Chandler Powell
Robert Irwin takes his uncle duties seriously — even when he's out from Down Under.
The reigning Dancing with the Stars champ and nature conservationist, 22, spoke with PEOPLE at the 2026 NFL Honors in San Francisco, Calif. on Thursday, Feb. 5. Irwin, who is attending his first Super Bowl this year, shared that he's making sure he brings back a souvenir for his 4-year-old niece, Grace Warrior.
"I always have to. Usually, it's a plush toy," says the proud uncle. "I'll go somewhere. I'll be like, 'I'm going to Africa. What animal do you want? What do you want me to bring back?' And she'll be like, 'A hippopotamus.'"
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.  
"Or if I'm going to America, she's like, 'You have to bring back a mountain lion.' So I have to find a little plush animal everywhere I go, and she's got her little collection. Mate, uncle duties, I take it very seriously," explains Irwin.
As for what animal Irwin is going to bring back this time?
"Ooh, she's in a whale phase right now," he shares. "We may have to go the whale route."
Irwin and his niece have a close bond. When he was competing on Dancing with the Stars, his sister Bindi Irwin brought her daughter and husband, Chandler Powell, to Los Angeles to cheer him on. Grace even got to attend one of her uncle's rehearsals.
Back in November, Bindi shared a sweet photo of her daughter Grace at Robert's rehearsal for the dancing competition series. In the adorable picture, Grace could be seen wearing a dark green sparkly dress with a green ribbon, posing with her arms over her head.
Bindi, who won season 21 of the reality dance show with partner Derek Hough, smiled with her arm around Robert, who crouched down next to his dancing partner, Witney Carson. "Celebrating 20 years of @dancingwiththestars. So incredibly special to bring Grace to the rehearsal studio," Bindi wrote in the caption.
"Her favourite part? 'Dance Class' with Witney and Uncle Robert. 🥹 My. Heart. #TeamIrWINit," she added.
At the end of September, Bindi shared a series of photos on Instagram ahead of attending a live taping of DWTS. In one sweet photo, Bindi and Powell posed with Grace in front of a multicolored mural.
Other photos showed just the mom and her daughter twirling together alone. Bindi wore a baby pink dress with flowers on the bodice, matching her daughter Grace's mini version. The two posed together for photos, smiling and dancing.
"Dancing all the way to @dancingwiththestars. 💕" Bindi wrote in her caption.

title: Love Island's Amaya Espinal Soft-Launches New Boyfriend 5 Months After Split from Bryan Arenales
description: 'Love Island USA' season 7 star Amaya Espinal has a new man in her life and teased fans as she revealed the romantic early Valentine's Day gifts he gave her.
content:
The 'Love Island USA' season 7 winners split in August, and Espinal, 26, teased a new beau as she showed off some romantic early Valentine's Day gifts
John Nacion/WireImage; Amaya Espinal/Instagram
Amaya Espinal seems to be off the market.
The Love Island USA season 7 winner soft-launched a new man on her Instagram Stories in a series of posts shared on Friday, Feb. 6.
The 26-year-old posted a video of two massive bouquets of roses, calling them an "early" Valentine's Day gift, and she wrote, "Mi bebe surprised me."
She also shared a selfie of herself posing with the two bouquets, along with a shot that featured her new boyfriend. Espinal posed with a peace sign as her new partner stood behind her, and though his face wasn't in the frame, his tattooed arms were on display behind her.
"Spa dates," she captioned the shot.
Espinal teased that she has a new love interest in her life on the red carpet at the American Heart Association Red Dress Collection Concert on Jan. 29.
"The way I protect my mind, my peace, my heart is just by knowing what's real and knowing what's not. I feel like, especially since we're so glued to the phone, we could sometimes digest things that are not meant to be digested and read too much into things," she told PEOPLE. "So I know when to turn my phone off, I know when I need to call my mom, call my manager, call my boyfriend to vent to. I think it's very important to know when your boundaries have to stop, you know."
She also teased her Valentine's Day plans with her new beau, as she said, "Me and my boyfriend, we are definitely going to be celebrating Valentine's Day together."

Espinal left the Love Island villa in July with Bryan Arenales, and the pair made things exclusive before being crowned the winners.
She confirmed her split from Arenales the following month. “My papayas - Bryan and I are no longer together,” she wrote on her Instagram Stories on Aug. 27.
“After leaving the villa, it became very clear that we were on two different journeys. Our visions didn’t align and relationships are supposed to be a team sport. You don’t have to drink the whole sea to know it’s salty. All love here and I truly wish him the best."
Just one day later, she told PEOPLE the split was "something I am still processing."
"But, I am very optimistic and very hopeful for the future," she said. "And I'm just happy to have such a large amount of support around me."

title: Everlane Just Landed on Amazon, and Its Most Popular T-Shirts, Pants, and More Are Already on Sale — Up to 64% Off
description: Everlane just launched on Amazon with its most popular clothes, shoes, and accessories. Many Everlane pieces are already on sale, including T-shirts, sweaters, barrel-leg pants, Oxford shirts, and more for up to 64 percent off
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
If you blink, these deals may just disappear
Amazon has long been a hub of must-have fashion deals, but an exciting new brand drop just took the already-impressive selection up a notch. 
Everlane launched a storefront on Amazon with its most popular clothes, shoes, and accessories. And with spring just around the corner, there’s never been a better time to stock up on easy-to-layer tees, versatile button-down shirts, and lightweight pants — especially while many pieces are on sale for up to 64 percent off. Keep scrolling for the best deals on Everlane basics, as well as full-price but hard-to-ignore favorites.
Whether you’re heading into the office or having a relaxed day at home, these cotton-and-linen-blend pants make for a comfortable option. They have a high-rise waist with adjustable buttoned sides, trendy patch pockets, and a curved silhouette that tapers at the ankle, perfect for pairing with a black T-shirt and loafers.
“This sweater completely changed my expectations for what a luxury knit can feel like,” said a five-star reviewer, who received the pullover for free. Choose from eight solid colors, including taupe, gray, and moss green, as well as sizes XXS–XXL.
Look polished without feeling restricted in this Oxford shirt, made from soft cotton and designed with a relaxed fit. Fully tuck it into a pair of trousers with a belt, half-tuck it into a pencil skirt, or wear it loose with a pair of jeans.
Wear these leggings for yoga sessions, running errands, and lounging at home. They’re made from soft, sweat-wicking, and breathable material with light compression, and they can be thrown in the washing machine at the end of the day. Not to mention, they come in both standard and short inseams, making them a perfect fit for petite shoppers. 
Cold weather is no match for this insulated puffer jacket, made from recycled down with a water-resistant outer layer. Choose from five colors, including a versatile dark green, classic black, and light beige. 
Style this classic crewneck T-shirt with everything from shorts to jeans, or use it as a base layer under your sweater on chilly days. Plus, a reviewer confirmed that the “fabric is light, but substantial enough that it is not see-through.” 
These wide-leg pants have a high-rise waist, angled front pockets, back patch pockets, and a trendy, relaxed cut that works for whatever your day has in store. Better yet, you can get them for 40 percent off their typical price.
A bit more of a splurge pick, this half-zip sweater adds sophistication to every look. Made from 100 percent Merino wool, it’s warm, polished, and looks great worn over a button-up shirt or long-sleeve tee.
Take the day off in joggers that combine a relaxed fit with a luxurious feel. Ideal for a lazy Sunday, they have an elastic waist with a drawstring closure and slanted pockets that are big enough to store your phone.
Thanks to its slim-fitting silhouette, this long-sleeve cotton tee easily tucks into jeans, pants, and skirts. Plus, it folds up nicely in a suitcase without worrying about wrinkles once you reach your destination.

title: Jennifer Lawrence and Gwyneth Paltrow Just Wore the Spring Jeans That Return Like Clockwork Every Year — from $29
description: Jennifer Lawrence, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Joanna Gaines all wore light-wash jeans recently. We found similar pairs of light-wash jeans for spring on Amazon from brands like Gap, Joe’s Jeans, Levi’s, Rag & Bone, and Good American, starting at $29
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Joanna Gaines was spotted in light-wash jeans recently, too
Joanna Gaines/Instagram; Taylor Hill/FilmMagic; Arnold Jerocki/Getty
The groundhog may have seen his shadow this year, but I’m manifesting an early spring. 
I know I’m not alone in hoping the sunshine comes sooner rather than later, since I’ve noticed so many celebs wearing spring-coded, light-wash jeans recently — proving that there’s no need to wait until the weather warms up to bring out the style. Throw them on with a white tee and long black coat like Jennifer Lawrence, add on a tweed blazer á la Joanna Gaines, or keep the look casual like Gwyneth Paltrow with an oversized hoodie.
Ready for your denim wardrobe to see the light? I rounded up eight pairs of light-wash jeans on Amazon from brands like Gap, Joe’s Jeans, Levi’s, and Rag & Bone, starting at $29.
If you love the ripped knees on Gaines’ jeans, try this similar, vintage-inspired pair with a relaxed, wide-leg silhouette, low-rise waist, and double-button fly. The pants come in sizes 23–34 with short and standard lengths available.
Lawrence’s light-wash jeans had ultra-wide, flared hems, and these jeans are a close lookalike. “If you need a confidence boost, grab these,” one shopper raved. “These jeans had me walking around with a little extra pep … they hug in the right places, smooth out what needs smoothing, and the flare is chef’s kiss.”
Paltrow already convinced me to buy a fuzzy sweater and comfy clogs, so it’s no surprise that I want her light-wash jeans, too. These baggy jeans are just like hers, thanks to the loose fit and higher-rise waist.
Jennifer Aniston, Bette Midler, and Kelly Clarkson have all stepped out in cuffed jeans lately, so you’ll be right on trend when you slip into this similar pair. They have a high-rise waist, zip-and-button fly, and five-pocket styling, and they come in sizes 23–34.
If you’ve been on the fence about trying these viral-yet-pricey sweatpant jeans, two of our editors are here to set your mind at ease. “We were both immediately impressed by just how much the sweatpants look like jeans,” said senior shopping writer Averi Baudler. “Sure, it’s in the name, but we found them to be truly indistinguishable from classic denim.”
The moment I spotted these barrel jeans, I was transported back to my childhood — because I had such a similar pair in the ’80s. I love the super-light wash (although they also come in two darker washes that are calling my name), and the fact that you can create two different looks by wearing them cuffed or uncuffed.
As a 5-foot-tall shopper, I’m always on the lookout for petite jeans to fit my shorter frame — so I’m happy to report that these wide-leg jeans are available in a short inseam. (Don’t worry, they also come in standard and tall lengths). They’re designed to hit right at the ankles on most people.
From Sharon Stone to Courteney Cox, many of our favorite celebrities have deemed straight-leg jeans the “it” denim style right now. Try the trend for yourself in this light-wash pair from Khloé Kardashian’s brand with a high-rise waist, zip-and-button fly, and five-pocket styling.

Feel free to thank me in advance: I put my shopping prowess to the test and discovered the best sales at Amazon right now. My search led me straight to the Amazon Deals hub, where I found staggering discounts on home, fashion, and beauty products.

My walking pad seriously transformed my daily movement routine. If you haven’t sprung for one yet, take this as your sign — this walking pad is marked down by $900. One buyer succinctly described it as “smooth, quiet, and easy to use.” Others praise it for its easy assembly (simply plug it in once unwrapped) and slim design. 
Using the combined power of spray, brush, and suction functions, this carpet cleaner makes quick work of unfortunate messes. Better yet, it can also be used to clean upholstery, such as couches and car interiors. “The machine is no louder than a vacuum cleaner and light enough to pick up [and] move to where it is needed,” according to one shopper.
Activewear prices have gotten out of hand, which is why I’ve made it my personal mission to track down budget-friendly options like these dark brown, high-waisted leggings that are only $9. One customer compared them to Lululemon leggings as they feel “like a second skin and move with you without riding down.” Another praised the “buttery soft” material. 
Tired of your bras pinching and constricting you throughout the day? This wireless bra is the answer. The undergarment is lightly padded and constructed with breathable material, so it offers gentle support. Reviewers rave over the bra’s softness and comfort. A big bonus is that the bra’s straps can be converted into a razorback style. 
Shop more of Amazon’s impressive deals while they’re still up for grabs. Some of my top finds include a cordless vacuum with a five-layer filtration system and memory-foam slippers that feel like “walking on clouds,” per shoppers.

title: KPop Demon Hunters' 'Golden' Trio Describe Record-Breaking Success of the Movie: 'Changed the World' (Exclusive)
description: EJAE, AUDREY NUNA and REI AMI, the three artists who serve as the singing voices of the main character trio, spoke to PEOPLE about the recording process to bring hit "Golden" to life.
content:
EJAE, AUDREY NUNA and REI AMI spoke to PEOPLE about the viral Netflix film and the recording process to bring song 'Golden' to life
EJAE, AUDREY NUNA and REI AMI — the three artists responsible for bringing viral song "Golden" to life in Netflix's hit animated film KPop Demon Hunters — are taking PEOPLE behind the scenes of their success.
"It literally changed the world, and it also changed mine," says REI AMI of the movie, which smashed records when it premiered last summer.
"The day it came out, June 20th, I remember getting off a plane and my phone was just blowing up," says EJAE. "And my fiancé loves Reddit, and his Reddit posts were all about KPop Demon Hunters. He was like 'Babe, I think this is getting pretty viral right now.'"
Gilbert Flores/Penske Media via Getty
"I thought this was pretty niche," admits AUDREY NUNA. "I know that K-pop groups and K-pop has had such global support for a long time now... but I just didn't think that it was going to become so mainstream the way that it has."
And, when asked to describe the recording process for Kpop Demon Hunters, each of the three women had different answers.
"Challenging," says AUDREY NUNA.
"Weirdly invigorating," added EJAE.
In the film, EJAE, AUDREY NUNA, and REI AMI sing for the roles of Rumi (Arden Cho), Mira (May Hong), and Zoey (Ji-young Yoo), respectively.
"Golden" scored three nominations at this year's Grammys: Song of the Year, Best Pop Duo/Group Performance and Best Song Written for Visual Media, while the entire soundtrack for KPop Demon Hunters was nominated for Best Compilation Soundtrack For Visual Media.
At Sunday's awards, it won for Best Song Written for Visual Media.
After learning of their Grammy nominations in November, the HUNTR/X girl group told PEOPLE that they were ecstatic.
"We all screamed," AUDREY NUNA said of how the trio, who was on zoom together for the news, reacted.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.  
For EJAE, who is one of the cowriters for "Golden" (alongside Mark Sonnenblick), the recognition speaks to a broader conversation around representation.
"I'm just so proud to be Korean because growing up in America, too, I felt ashamed being Korean at one point. I felt ostracized, and so I'm just happy to be a part of this incredible cultural phenomenon to be able to show off our country," she previously told PEOPLE.
KPop Demon Hunters quickly became the most-watched animated movie on Netflix after its debut in June 2025. It's also the platform’s most popular film of all time with over 236 million views and counting.
The film's soundtrack made just as big a wave when it debuted at No. 1 on Billboard’s Soundtracks chart and No. 8 on the all-genre Billboard 200. It also became the first soundtrack with four simultaneous Top 10 songs on the Billboard Hot 100.
KPop Demon Hunters is available now to stream on Netflix.

title: Boy, 3, Killed in Hostage Situation with Cops After Dad Threatened to Kill Child: Police
description: Authorities say Kentre Baker was shot three times, and two of the gunshot wounds allegedly came from his father's firearm
content:
Authorities say Kentre Baker was shot three times, and two of the gunshot wounds allegedly came from his father's firearm
Authorities in Nevada have released bodycam footage from the fatal shooting of a 3-year-old boy who was killed while being carried by his father, who allegedly approached police with a gun.
Kentre Baker was killed in the Tuesday, Feb. 3, shooting outside a Las Vegas, Nev., residence, officers with the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department said at a press briefing this week.
Kentre's father, 28-year-old Quentin Baker, who police allege approached officers with a gun while pointing it at the child, was killed in the shooting, LVMPD Assistant Sheriff Bryan Peterson said at the briefing on Thursday. Feb. 5.
The investigation began with a 911 call in which a woman told the dispatcher that Quentin was threatening to kill her and kill their son. (Police did not name the woman, but she was identified by the Las Vegas Review-Journal, News13 and in a GoFundMe as Raneka Pate.)
Pate told responding officers that Quentin allegedly threatened her, saying, "If you don't tell them to call this s--- off, and if they try to come up these stairs, I'm blowing the child's brains out, and I'm blowing mine out. You won't have neither one of us."

In newly released bodycam footage, a man police identify as Quentin is seen walking toward officers while carrying his 3-year-old son, Kentre, in his left arm. Police say Quentin was pointing a gun at the child as he approached; when officers ordered him to drop the weapon, he did not deny having a gun and instead said he wanted to see Pate, according to police.

A shooting ensues, and it's not clear whether Quentin started the shooting or the officers.
Police allege Kentre died from close-range gunshot wounds to his head, and that he'd been shot by Quentin.

The child had been shot three times, per Peterson, and two of those shots were allegedly from Kentre's gun. Peterson said it has not been "determined" where the third shot came from.
Pate told the Review-Journal she watched from a patrol car as Quentin and Ketre were shot, and claimed Quentin was not armed when he approached police.
“There was a plethora of bullets,” she said.
Quentin died at the scene. Kentre died after being taken to a hospital.
“They are trying to play damage control, but they will pay for killing my son,” Pate claimed to the Review-Journal of LVMPD.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.

Quentin would've been charged with murder, several domestic violence-related offenses and child abuse had he lived, Peterson said.
The officers involved have been identified by LVMPD as 39-year-old Jonthan Low who has been with the department since 2019, and 26-year-old Daymon O'Donnell, who has been with LVMPD since 2024.  They have not been formally accused of any wrongdoing.
Low fired three rounds and O'Donnell fired two rounds during the incident, Peterson said.
If you are experiencing domestic violence, call the National Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-799-7233, or go to thehotline.org. All calls are toll-free and confidential. The hotline is available 24/7 in more than 170 languages.

title: He Met a Woman Online and Had Hopes for a Well-Paying Job. Weeks Later, He Ended Up Dead in a Trashcan
description: David Hutchinson, 32, was found dead inside a trash can on Jan. 29.
content:
David Hutchinson, 32, was found dead inside a trash can on Jan. 29
Mystery surrounds the death of a Massachusetts man whose remains were discovered inside a trash can in South Carolina.
The body of David Hutchinson, 32, was found decomposing inside a trash can at a home on Pearl Street in Marion on Thursday, Jan. 29, per the Marion County Coroner, WMBF reported.
Authorities are investigating his death as a homicide, Marion Police Chief Tony Flowers told News13.
Hutchinson arrived in Marion in December, allegedly after a woman he allegedly met online told him he could find a well-paying job in the area, Flowers said, WMBF reported. He was scheduled to return to Massachusetts in early January — but when he didn’t return home, his family alerted police.
In an interview with ABC4, Flowers alleged there were potentially 12 persons of interest in the case.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for  PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.
"It could be 12,” he said. “I don't know how many was involved. Because this house he was supposedly at, it is people in and out of the house all the time. So, there's no rhyme or reason to who lives there, who doesn't. So, we don't know how all how many people were there when this happened. If it actually happened inside the house, outside the house, in the area."
On Jan. 30, Jaida Braddy, 41, was arrested and charged with accessory after the fact to a felony in connection with Hutchinson's death and is being held on a $15,000 surety bond, according to inmate records.
“David isn’t just a drifter who showed up in town, or another statistic,” his brother told News13.  “He’s a son, a brother, a cousin. An uncle and a friend to a lot of people up here who loved him tremendously. We prayed this story would have a better ending, and we’ll miss him so much.”
“Naive and too trusting, but a good kid who made bad decisions at times, and this time he sadly had to pay the ultimate price for it,” he added.
According to a GoFundMe page, Hutchinson, a barber, had a "kind heart and the biggest personality. He was loved by all those who knew him and friendly to those who didn’t."

title: A Woman Vanished for 2 Years. Now, Someone She Knew Has Admitted Pushing Her Off a Cliff
description: Loretta Carr was sentenced to life in prison plus 20 years for murder and kidnapping in the death of 37-year-old Mary Beth Isbell.
content:
Loretta Carr was sentenced to life in prison plus 20 years for murder and kidnapping in the death of 37-year-old Mary Beth Isbell
Hartselle Police Department/ Facebook
An Alabama woman was sentenced to life in prison for her role in the death of a woman who was kidnapped and pushed off a cliff.
Loretta Carr was also sentenced to 20 additional years for kidnapping in connection with the 2021 death of 37-year-old Mary Beth Isbell, the District Attorney for the Ninth Judicial Circuit announced on Friday, Feb. 6.
Carr pleaded guilty to first-degree kidnapping and murder on Thursday, Feb. 5, AL.com reported, citing court records. 
Carr’s daughter Jessie Kelly pleaded guilty to murder in August 2025 and was sentenced to 40 years in prison, per WAFF.
According to prosecutors, Carr and Kelly went to Isbell’s home to “confront her because of a relationship she had with Carr’s significant other” on Oct. 18, 2021. The two allegedly attacked Isbell, took her against her will and dragged her inside a vehicle, prosecutors said, citing statements and forensic evidence discovered at Isbell’s residence.
Later that night, they drove to Wolf Creek Overlook at Little River Canyon in Fort Payne where Carr “tied herself with a rope to the barrier at the overlook, forced Isbell to climb over the barrier, and then forced her off the side of the canyon,” per a Ninth Judicial Circuit press release.
DeKalb County Sheriff's Office; Cherokee County Sheriff's Office
Isbell’s body was discovered two years later in the canyon beneath the overlook. 
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for  PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.
Isbell was reported missing in December 2021, per ABC31.

“This is an example of a senseless act destroying a family,” prosecutor Summer Summerford said in the press release. “A mother is left without a daughter, sisters are left without their sibling, and a son is left without his mother."
"This family has been through so much, but they have walked with us and law enforcement throughout this process and have been so responsive and helpful. Please continue to pray for this family as they continue to figure out how to go through life without their loved one.”
Isbell owned her own remodeling business and was the mother of a teen boy, her family said, according to ABC31.

title: Girl, 12, Walking Dog Was Allegedly Kidnapped and Sexually Assaulted. Here's How Police Rescued Her From a Hotel Room
description: Authorities in Texas arrested 27-year-old Graham Michael Dunn on kidnapping and sexual assault charges, police announced at a press conference.
content:
Authorities in Texas arrested 27-year-old Graham Michael Dunn on kidnapping and sexual assault charges, police announced at a press conference
Authorities in southeastern Texas have arrested a man they accuse of kidnapping a girl following a dramatic rescue operation at a hotel.
Graham Michael Dunn, 27, was arrested on several charges, including sexual assault of a child, in connection with the alleged abduction of a 12-year-old girl in Galveston, Texas, on Jan. 30, the Galveston Police Department said at a press briefing this week.
The child was reported missing in the evening on Jan. 30, Chief of Police Doug Balli said at the briefing on Thursday, Feb. 5.
Police believe the girl was walking her dog when she was "encountered by Graham Dunn," who had pulled up in his car. Dunn allegedly got out of the vehicle and forced the child inside of it, before fleeing the area, Balli said.
Investigators followed an "emergency ping" on the girl's phone and located the ping at a hotel a few miles away.
Hotel staff initially had difficulty obtaining security footage, but later provided investigators with surveillance video that allegedly shows Dunn entering the hotel with the girl, the police said.
Officers then broke into a room and rescued the child before apprehending Dunn.
While no motive has been discussed about why the child was targeted, police allege Dunn used social media to "lure" the girl out.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.

Dunn has been charged with one count of aggravated kidnapping - sexual assault and two counts of aggravated sexual assault of a child, Detective Hector Dominguez said at Thursday's briefing.
Online court records for Dunn only showed a kidnapping charge as of noon Friday. No plea information was available, and an attorney listed in court records for him did not immediately respond to PEOPLE's request for comment.
If you or someone you know has been a victim of sexual abuse, text "STRENGTH" to the Crisis Text Line at 741-741 to be connected to a certified crisis counselor.

If you suspect child abuse, call the Childhelp National Child Abuse Hotline at 1-800-4-A-Child or 1-800-422-4453, or go to www.childhelp.org. All calls are toll-free and confidential. The hotline is available 24/7 in more than 170 languages.

title: Husband of Woman Who Said She Was 'Very Scared' Before Vanishing Will Go to Prison for Manslaughter
description: Glenn Jackson entered an Alford plea to a manslaughter charge in connection with the death of his wife Ella, who went missing in 2019.
content:
Glenn Jackson entered an Alford plea to a manslaughter charge in connection with the death of his wife Ella, who went missing in 2019
A Kentucky man entered an Alford plea to a manslaughter charge in connection with the death of his wife, whom he reported missing six years ago.
Glenn Jackson will now likely face face prison time following the plea, which was reported by the Lexington Herald Leader, Fox 56 and LEX 18.
An Alford plea allows a defendant to maintain innocence while also admitting there is likely enough evidence for prosecutors to secure a conviction.
Ella Diebolt Jackson was reported missing in Richmond, Kent., by Glenn on Oct. 22, 2019, PEOPLE previously reported.
In 2020, Glenn was charged with murder and tampering with evidence in connection with the disappearance of Ella.
A week after Glenn was arrested, Ella's partial skeletal remains were found in a wooded area near a property he owned, per LEX 18.
At the time of her death, Ella and Glenn had a 5-year-old son together.
Ella’s ex-husband, Jason Hans, wrote on Facebook that he remained friends with her even after they divorced more than a decade before her death. He claimed that Ella had begun fearing for her safety in 2015.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.         
“The messages and rushed phone calls were all too regular in recent years: ‘I need your help,’ ‘I am very scared,’ ‘I am scared to the point of not being ok to get out of the bedroom to get a cup of milk or change my tampon,’ ‘I am being awakened at almost 3 in the morning and dragged through the house,’ ‘It is getting seriously scary [and] I am very worried about my child and myself,'” Hans wrote in 2020.
Glenn, a former lecturer at Eastern Kentucky University, also entered an Alford Plea to abuse of a corpse and tampering with evidence, in addition to mansalughter, per the Herald Leader.
Prosecutors recommended a 14-year sentence for Glenn, who could be released in as little as eight if given credit for house arrest as time served, LEX 18 reported.

title: 6 People Tied to an Online 'Cult' Vanished in August 2023. A New TikTok Video May Point to Their Whereabouts
description: Police in Berkeley, Missouri, are still searching for six people they believe to be tied to an online cult who vanished in August 2023. They think they may have now found a 'very promising' TikTok video which could lead them to the individuals.
content:
A man, three women and two young children haven't been heard from since they went missing from their rented home in Berkeley, Missouri, over two years ago
Police believe they may have found a "very promising" TikTok video that could potentially lead them to six people in Missouri who have been missing since August 2023.
Ma’Kayla Wickerson, 28, and her now 5-year-old daughter, Malaiyah Wickerson, and Gerrielle German, 30, and her 5-year-old daughter Ashton Mitchell haven't been heard from in years, KTVI's Fox 2 reported. Mikayla Thompson, 27, and Naaman Williams, 32, are also missing.
The missing individuals had been living in a rented home in Berkeley, Mo., near St. Louis Lambert International Airport, PEOPLE previously reported. The group was last seen at a hotel on Aug. 13, 2023, in Florissant, Mo. and no one has heard from them since, Berkeley Police Major Steve Runge said.
Runge told PEOPLE in January 2024 that the four missing adults were believed to be part of a cult allegedly revolving around Rashad Jamal, who was convicted of child molestation charges in 2023 and is currently serving a prison sentence in Georgia.
In recent years, Jamal has amassed thousands of followers on social media with his spiritual teachings, operating what he calls the University of Cosmic Intelligence, which according to its website is “geared toward enlightening and illuminating minds” of Black and Latino people. 
Speaking to the St. Louis Post-Dispatch from prison, Jamal previously denied being a cult leader and maintained his innocence in his child molestation case. 
Runge has now told Fox 2 that police are aware of a new TikTok clip appearing to feature one of the women, which he's described as "very promising."
Runge told PEOPLE via email that the video shows Gerielle German.
"We have submitted a legal demand to [TikTok] for the release of user data associated with that user page, as well [as] an IP location for any recent posts," he told PEOPLE.
Berkeley Police detective, Sergeant George Ervin, questioned about the video, “Was it actually our missing person? Or is this some copycat just using a picture?” per Fox 2. Ervin is now working to serve TikTok with a warrant to find the account holder.
“I know that it seems like some stuff you’d see fresh out of a movie in Hollywood, but this is real life. These people are missing,” Ervin told the station.
“I really hope we find them,” Runge added, per the outlet. “I’ve promised the families that we will not give up, and we haven’t given up.”
Runge told Fox 2 of the group's disappearance, “There’s no footprint whatsoever, no current digital footprint." He's obtained a personal record number of search warrants for the case.
“We’re trying to find any lead,” Runge told the station, adding, “Common places they went, rental cars, phone records out of state, out of the country, trying to find any ties to give us a lead as to where they are.”
Before their disappearance, neighbors reported seeing some of the missing six on the roof of their rental home, naked, per Fox 2.
“Really off the grid kind of stuff,” Runge told the outlet. “How to prepare for doomsday. A lot of it, the end of the world is coming. And they had a very solid belief that we’re not from here. We’re not from this planet.”
“We recovered a diary from one of the people that went missing, and the writings in that diary are something you would see with brainwashing, just repetitive, 'I am a god, I am a god, I am a god,'” Runge said, per Fox 2.
Runge previously told PEOPLE that some of Rashad Jamal’s followers, whom he said include three of the missing adults, had changed their names in honor of those they believe to be spiritual gods or goddesses. Williams is also known as Anubis Aramean, Thompson goes by Antu Anum Ahmat, while Wickerson is Intuahma Aquama Auntil, according to Berkeley Police. 
Police also said that the Berkeley quartet had allegedly been exhibiting some of the other followers’ behaviors: total disconnection from family and loved ones, a desire to go off the grid, quitting their jobs and embracing sovereign citizenship, among other behaviors.
“It’s confusing, the internet is [the group's] home,” Runge said in January 2024. “It’s not like, ‘Okay, we’re going to go to St. Louis.’ No, the internet is its home. [Jamal] has 90,000 followers.”
Runge previously said that Wickerson’s mother, Cartisha Morgan, had called police on Aug. 12, 2023, to say she was worried about her daughter, whom she hadn't heard from. 
Days later, detectives began investigating and searched the Berkeley home and found no signs of foul play. Runge said they discovered the group’s Facebook profiles, which contained references to Jamal and were once extremely active and public before the activity abruptly stopped.
While Wickerson, who according to her LinkedIn profile once worked for JP Morgan Chase, and Thompson are both from St. Louis, Williams is from Washington D.C., while German is originally from Lake Horn, Miss., near Memphis.
Thompson, like the other two women, is also the mother of a young child whom she left behind with her mother, according to Runge.
Morgan previously told PEOPLE in January 2024 that she was worried about her daughter and granddaughter, saying that she believed Wickerson had been suffering from depression following the birth of her daughter, and that she was preyed upon as a result.
“I'm not doing so well, but I'm just holding on by my faith,” Morgan told PEOPLE at the time. “I just wish that people are made aware of this.”
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for  PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.
Wickerson had been living with her mother while she was pregnant before moving out in November 2022. Morgan last heard from her daughter in March 2023.
Morgan recalled Wickerson telling her she was feeling overwhelmed as a mother, adding that she thinks her daughter was crying out for help and that there were signs she wasn't okay.
Calling her daughter's disappearance “astonishing,” because she was very family-oriented, Morgan previously told PEOPLE, “Ma’Kayla, we love you and we want the best for you. We would like for her to come back home. We are going to get her the help that we need. Your spiritual journey is your spiritual journey. If you want to be your best self, we understand that, but we love you and we just want you to come back home.”
