title: Teen, 14, Tied to 'Neo-Nazi Satanic Group' Busted for Allegedly Plotting Mass Shooting at Church
description: A Florida teenager accused of plotting a church shooting near his home in Wimauma is now facing terrorism and child pornography charges after authorities said investigators linked him to an extremist chatroom and recovered disturbing images and weapons during a search.
content:
The teen allegedly discussed mass violence in an extremist chatroom before graphic images of infants and toddlers were uncovered on his devices
A Florida teenager is accused of plotting a mass shooting in an online extremist chatroom, prompting a search that uncovered child pornography on his devices.
Hillsborough County Sheriff Chad Chronister said in a Facebook video briefing that the teen was arrested Jan. 31 after investigators received a tip that he had access to weapons and was threatening violence.
The teen had been active in an online chatroom tied to violent extremism and discussed shooting up a nearby church, though he did not specify which one, Chronister said. Investigators linked the home to an active child exploitation probe coming from the same IP address, Chronister said.
Want to keep up with the latest crime coverage? Sign up for  PEOPLE's free True Crime newsletter for breaking crime news, ongoing trial coverage and details of intriguing unsolved cases.

Detectives executed a search warrant at the residence, where they recovered multiple firearms and ammunition, along with electronic devices containing child sex abuse material, Chronister said during the briefing. He added that while most weapons were secured in a safe, one firearm was found in the father’s nightstand that the teen “easily could have had access to.”
Chronister said they discovered 14 "extremely graphic, disturbing" images "where individuals were inflicting violence towards infants and toddlers" — images he told reporters were "too graphic and too disturbing to discuss," because they "would keep all of you up at night."

Investigators also linked the teen to a "neo-Nazi Satanic group" known as Temple of Love, which promotes violence as a form of spiritual enlightenment, Chronister said. During questioning, the teen appeared unbothered and told deputies he was “trying to be edgy,” Chronister said.
"The age of the individual involved does not lessen the seriousness of these crimes,” Chronister said. “Threats of mass violence and the exploitation of children demand immediate action, and we will always move swiftly to protect lives and hold those responsible accountable.”
The teen is charged as a juvenile with written or electronic threat to conduct a mass shooting or act of terrorism, in-state transmission of child pornography by electronic device, 14 counts of solicitation or possession of child pornography involving 10 or more images and two counts of unlawful use of a two-way communications device, per the briefing.
Chronister said additional charges could follow as forensic exams of the teen’s devices continue. The State Attorney’s Office will determine whether he will ultimately be charged as an adult.
If you suspect child abuse, call the Childhelp National Child Abuse Hotline at 1-800-4-A-Child or 1-800-422-4453, or go to www.childhelp.org. All calls are toll-free and confidential. The hotline is available 24/7 in more than 170 languages.

title: Human Remains Found Over a Year Ago Identified as 43-Year-Old Man Who Vanished from Reservation
description: More than a year after human remains were discovered, authorities have identified them as a 43-year-old man who disappeared from a Native American reservation.
content:
Gabriel Calfbossribs disappeared in the summer of 2024, authorities said
Blackfeet Law Enforcement Services Facebook
More than a year after human remains were discovered, authorities have identified them as a 43-year-old man who disappeared from a Native American reservation.
The Glacier County Sheriff’s Office said in a release that after a year-and-a-half investigation led by Deputy Jolee Bullshoe, the remains were positively identified as Gabriel Calfbossribs.
The sheriff’s office said officers responded to a report of human remains found in the vicinity of the Boarding School area on September 28, 2024. 
“Deputy Bullshoe devoted numerous hours to the case and worked closely with the Montana State Crime Labs and the University of North Texas to obtain a DNA match,” authorities said.
The cause and manner of Calfbossribs' death are currently undetermined, according to the sheriff’s office. 
Calfbossribs had been missing since the summer of 2024 from the Blackfeet Reservation in northwest Montana, according to authorities.
“After a while (we) haven’t got no contact with him, haven't seen him and stuff,” Daniel Calfbossribs, Gabriel’s uncle, told NBC Montana in May. “And then start hearing stories that there was a gun pulled on him, so that's what really got me start worrying.”
Rumors of Calfbossribs’ possible whereabouts had his family searching abandoned buildings and a dump.
“It hasn’t been easy hearing those stories, it hasn’t been easy thinking about what could have happened or how it happened, but it doesn’t stop us,” Marla Nightgun, Gabriel’s cousin, also told the outlet.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. 
In its statement, the Glacier County Sheriff’s Office offered its condolences to the victim's family and those affected by the death. 
“The Sheriff's Office is grateful to be able to provide answers and a measure of closure to his loved ones,” officials added.

title: Kate Middleton Sparks Speculation About Her Birthday Gift from Prince William with New Heart Necklace
description: Kate Middleton sparked speculation about a birthday gift from Prince William when she debuted a new heart necklace. See photos of Princess Kate's jewelry.
content:
The Princess of Wales glimmered in gold jewelry for a behind-closed-doors meeting alongside her husband
Aaron Chown / POOL / AFP via Getty
Kate Middleton debuted a new piece of jewelry just weeks after her 44th birthday, raising speculation that it could be a birthday gift from Prince William.
On Feb. 5, the Prince and Princess of Wales held a meeting with Archbishop Sarah Mullally, the new Archbishop of Canterbury, at Lambeth Palace in London. Mullally is the first female Archbishop of Canterbury in the Church of England's 1,428-year history, and Princess Kate slipped on a new necklace for the occasion.
The Princess of Wales brought the glimmer with a gold heart pendant on a paper clip chain, widely identified as by Daniella Draper. 
Kate's necklace looked like the British brand's Gold Keeper's Heart Trace Chain Necklace, which retails beginning at $2,200 without personalization.
Andrew Parsons / Kensington Palace
The Gold Keeper's Heart Trace Chain Necklace is handmade in England with recycled 9ct yellow gold. According to the jeweler, the piece symbolizes "love and connection" and "captures the essence of affection, serving as a meaningful reminder of your everlasting love."
Princess Kate's heart pendant also appeared to be engraved, though the personalization was difficult to discern.
The Princess of Wales turned 44 on Jan. 9 and debuted the necklace one month later, sparking the thought that it could be a birthday present.
Prince William, 43, has previously given his wife meaningful jewelry through the years, including the iconic sapphire and diamond engagement ring that previously belonged to his late mother, Princess Diana. It is also widely believed that he gave her a white gold and diamond Annoushka eternity ring following the birth of their first child, Prince George, now 12, and she continues to wear the ring often today.
The Princess of Wales has several Daniella Draper necklaces in her collection, personalized with the initials of her children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte, 10, and Prince Louis, 7. Perhaps her best-known necklace from the label is her Gold Diamond Midnight Moon Necklace, engraved with G, C and L and three diamond stars.
Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! 
Princess Kate has had her Gold Diamond Midnight Moon necklace in her jewelry box since at least 2020, and Draper previously told PEOPLE it meant much to see her wear it. 
Calling Kate an "incredible role model," Draper said. "I look up to her as a young woman and a mother. Seeing her wearing one of my designs was a very proud moment. Everyone in the workshop thinks it's just amazing. It's good morale!"

title: Prince Harry's Home Office Decor Includes a Photo with Princess Diana and a Card from Archie and Lili
description: Prince Harry's office features a photo of the late Princess Diana and an adorable card from his children, Archie and Lilibet, as seen in Meghan Markle's new Instagram video.
content:
A sweet Instagram video revealed some of the prince's sentimental decorations
Georges De Keerle/Getty; Meghan Markle/Instagram
Meghan Markle's latest Instagram video gave royal fans a look at some of Prince Harry's cherished mementos.
The Duchess of Sussex, 44, posted a video to her Instagram Stories on Thursday, Feb. 5, celebrating the launch of her As ever brand's most recent collaboration with luxury chocolatier Compartés. In the clip, she surprised Harry, 41, in his office at their Montecito, Calif., home, where he was seated barefoot at his desk, with the family's rescue beagle, Mia, resting in a basket nearby.
Meghan presented the new collection of four flavors to her husband, who exclaimed, "Ooh, yes please," as he selected the white chocolate bar with flower sprinkles and hemp hearts.
"White chocolate? You got it," Meghan commented before Harry replied, "Thank you, love you." 
The exchange also provided a look at Harry's office decor, which features a few items of sentimental value.
One of the most visible in the clip is a glass display case featuring what appears to be a collection of military patches. The patches were reportedly gifted to the prince by the Ukrainian team from the Invictus Games, the international adaptive sports tournament for veterans and service personnel that Harry, a veteran of the British Army, founded in 2014.
Displayed on the wall just behind Harry is a card that reads "Love You Papa" on the front, likely a joint gift from Harry and Meghan's children, Prince Archie, 6, and Princess Lilibet, 4, who refer to him by the moniker.
Next to the card is a photo that, while just barely visible in the video, eagle-eyed royal fans recognized as a portrait of Harry with his beloved late mother, Princess Diana.
The image of Diana — in a white swimsuit, short-cropped hair held back by sunglasses atop her head, a beaming young Harry hugging her from behind — is featured in the Duke of Sussex's 2023 memoir, Spare. He included the personal pic at the end of the prologue, in which he writes lovingly about his late mother.
"Although my mother was a princess, named after a goddess, both those terms always felt weak, inadequate. People routinely compared her to icons and saints, from Nelson Mandela to Mother Teresa to Joan of Arc, but every such comparison, while lofty and loving, also felt wide of the mark. The most recognizable woman on the planet, one of the most beloved, my mother was simply indescribable; that was the plain truth," Harry wrote.
"And yet…how could someone so far beyond everyday language remain so real, so palpably present, so exquisitely vivid in my mind? How was it possible that I could see her, clear as the swan skimming towards me on that indigo lake? How could I hear her laughter, loud as the songbirds in the bare trees—still? There was so much I didn’t remember, because I was so young when she died, but the greater miracle was all that I did. Her devastating smile, her vulnerable eyes, her childlike love of movies and music and clothes and sweets—and us. Oh how she loved my brother and me. Obsessively, she once confessed to an interviewer. Well, Mummy…vice versa."
Tim Graham Photo Library via Getty
Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! 
Prince Harry and Meghan moved their family to Montecito in 2020, after stepping back from their roles as working royals and amid the family rift that Harry details in Spare.
Meghan has shared some small details about their California abode, including the one feature that inspired her As ever logo: two palm trees in their backyard that connect at their base. In a 2022 interview with The Cut, Meghan shared how the trees caught Harry's eye when they first toured the house.
"One of the first things my husband saw when we walked around the house was those two palm trees," she said. "See how they’re connected at the bottom? He goes, 'My love, it’s us.' "
"And now every day when Archie goes by us, he says, ‘Hi, Momma. Hi, Papa,' " Meghan added.

title: Norway's Princess Mette-Marit Apologizes for Epstein Friendship: 'I Have Disappointed'
description: Crown Princess Mette-Marit of Norway has officially apologized for her "friendship" with the late Jeffrey Epstein. See Crown Princess Mette-Marit's full statement.
content:
"I would like to express my deepest regret for my friendship with Jeffrey Epstein," Crown Princess Mette-Marit began
Rune Hellestad - Corbis/Getty; Davidoff Studios/Getty 
Crown Princess Mette-Marit of Norway is officially apologizing for her friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.
On Feb. 6, the Royal House of Norway released a new statement from the Crown Princess, 52. The update came one week after the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) published over three million additional pages related to the Epstein Files Transparency Act, including what appeared to be emails between Mette-Marit and Epstein that indicated a friendship. 
"I would like to express my deepest regret for my friendship with Jeffrey Epstein. It is important for me to apologize to all of you that I have disappointed," began the statement from Crown Princess Mette-Marit, translated into English. 
"Some of the content of the messages between Epstein and me does not represent the person I want to be. I also apologize for the situation that I have put the Royal Family in, especially the King and Queen," she continued, referring to her in-laws, King Harald and Queen Sonja.
Rune Hellestad - Corbis/Corbis via Getty; Rick Friedman/Corbis via Getty
Mette-Marit's apology was shared within a longer statement from the Royal House of Norway, which underscored her regret about her association with Epstein. The disgraced American financier was a convicted sex offender who died in prison while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges in August 2019.
According to an English translation, the statement from the palace began, "We understand the strong reactions people have to what has emerged in recent days. The Crown Princess strongly disavows Epstein's abuse and criminal acts. She is very sorry for not having understood early enough what kind of person he was."
"The Crown Princess wants to tell about what happened and explain herself in more detail. She cannot do that now. The Crown Princess is in a very demanding situation," it continued. "She hopes for understanding that she needs time to gather herself."
The difficult predicament that the palace referenced could have been an allusion to the ongoing court case involving her son, Marius Borg Høiby. Marius, 29, is Crown Princess Mette-Marit's son from a relationship prior to her marriage to Crown Prince Haakon, and he headed to trial this week on Feb. 3 on 38 charges, including four counts of rape.  
On Tuesday, he pleaded not guilty to four counts of rape and one count of domestic violence, and pleaded guilty to offensive sexual behavior, speeding and driving without a valid license, Reuters said.
In December 2025, the palace also announced that the princess was being assessed for a lung transplant amid a "clear worsening" of her health. Mette-Marit has chronic pulmonary fibrosis, a lung disease that occurs when lung tissue becomes scarred, and lung transplants are an option for treatment.
The palace's Feb. 6 statement also outlined Crown Princess Mette-Marit's Jan. 31 mea culpa about regretting her contact with Epstein and detailed that she met Epstein in "social contexts, most of them in the United States." It also included Mette-Marit's December 2019 statement disavowing her links to Epstein, a remark she released after then-Prince Andrew announced his step back from his royal role following a damaging BBC interview about his ties to Epstein.
On Friday, Crown Prince Haakon, 52, spoke out to the press about the scandals affecting his family and his ongoing support for his wife. The future king of Norway "asked a large press corps to gather" before he spoke, opening up amid an official visit to Oslo Sami kindergarten, NRK reported.
"When there is a lot happening at once, as it has been for our family now, I am a little concerned that we must have the priorities in the right order," the outlet reported that Crown Prince Haakon said, per an English translation.  
"For me, the most important thing in recent days has been to take care of the flock. We support Marius in the situation he is in, we look after the other children – they must also be looked after – and I have to look after and take care of the Crown Princess," he continued. "Fortunately, she takes care of me too."
Haakon acknowledged the attention around Mette-Marit and stressed that she wanted to respond.
Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! 
"The Crown Princess understands that there are many who want to hear from her. She would like to tell. But now she can't. And I also tell her that she is not allowed to," he said. "She would like to tell more about the case, and we hope there is understanding that she needs some time."
The prince's mention of children referenced Princess Ingrid Alexandra, 21, and Prince Sverre Magnus, 20, his daughter and son whom he shares with his wife.
At this time, Crown Prince Haakon is acting as regent while his father, King Harald, 88, is in Italy for the Winter Olympics.

title: King Charles' Chickens Live in a Hutch with a Punny Name, Just Like Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's Flock
description: King Charles introduced a royal chicken coop in his new documentary "Finding Harmony: A King's Vision," drawing comparisons to Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's California coop.
content:
The King isn't the only one with a witty chicken coop name
King Charles unveiled a new royal residence in his documentary by opening the doors to Cluckingham Palace.
Finding Harmony: A King's Vision premiered globally on Amazon's Prime Video on Friday, Feb. 6, and a must-see moment shows the King, 77, stepping inside Cluckingham Palace, a chicken coop at his beloved Highgrove estate.
As seen in an official snippet of the documentary shared to Instagram, the rain boot-clad King brought a bucket of feed into Cluckingham Palace and left with a basket full of brown eggs.
"That's a good haul," someone behind the camera commented. 
"Well, the great thing is you give them something in return," the sovereign responded with a chuckle. "At least they can peck about here, they love it," he added about the space for the birds.
Cluckingham Palace is a witty play on Buckingham Palace, the royal family's iconic residence in London, and the lighthearted moniker is reminiscent of the punny name of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's chicken coop at their home in Montecito, California.
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have a chicken coop at their house called Archie's Chick Inn, nodding to the name of their son, Prince Archie, 6. Prince Harry, 41, and Meghan, 44, bought their home in Montecito in 2020 after stepping back from their royal roles in the U.K. and their daughter Princess Lilibet, 4, was born in California in 2021.
The world got a glimpse of Archie's Chick Inn during the couple's interview with Oprah Winfrey, which aired on CBS in March 2021. There, Oprah noticed the sign reading "Archie's Chick Inn — established 2021" for the coop housing hens rescued from a factory farm.
"I just love rescuing," Meghan said about the flock.
Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! 
Though King Charles and Harry, his younger son, remain estranged amid a familial rift that became public when he and Meghan stepped back from their royal roles in 2020, old footage of the father and son is featured in Finding Harmony.
The documentary chronicles King Charles' lifelong commitment to the environment and includes a quick clip of Prince Harry fly fishing with his father as a young boy.
Finding Harmony: A King's Vision highlights the sovereign's work through The King's Foundation, the charity he founded in 1990 inspired by his philosophy of harmony, and is narrated by King's Foundation ambassador Kate Winslet.
King Charles and Queen Camilla attended the documentary's glam premiere at Windsor Castle on Jan. 28 in a special screening thought to be the first premiere in a royal residence.
Finding Harmony: A King's Vision is now streaming on Prime Video.

title: Meghan Markle Makes a Special Delivery to a Barefoot Prince Harry in New Home Video
description: Meghan Markle shared a new Instagram video where Prince Harry was happily accepted a chocolate bar from her As ever brand.
content:
"Ooh, yes please," the Duke of Sussex said when Meghan brought him sweet treats
Cindy Ord/Getty; Meghan Markle/Instagram
Prince Harry happily accepted a tasty delivery from Meghan Markle!
On Feb. 5, the Duchess of Sussex, 44, posted a new video to her Instagram Stories that captured her delivering her husband chocolates from her As ever brand's collaboration with Compartés.
The video, filmed by Meghan, began with her walking with four of the As ever chocolate bars in a box and rolled to show the family's rescue beagle, Mia, resting in a basket at Harry's feet. 
The Duke of Sussex, 41, was barefoot as he sat at a desk with a laptop in a cozy office, with a case of what appeared to be military patches behind him, which were reportedly gifted to him by Ukraine's Invictus Games team. Prince Harry is a veteran of the British Army and the founding patron of the Invictus Games, an international adaptive sports tournament for veterans and service personnel.
Harry and Meghan greeted each other with, "Hello," and he exclaimed, "Ooh, yes please," when she handed him the box of bars.
"White chocolate? You got it," Meghan said, commenting on her husband's choice, as Harry said, "Thank you, love you." 
On Jan. 31, the Duchess of Sussex's As ever brand launched an expanded collaboration with Compartés chocolates featuring four flavors. As ever previously teamed up with the Los Angeles chocolatier for a pre-Christmas collection that quickly sold out in December 2025, and Prince Harry reached for the White Chocolate Bar with flower sprinkles and hemp hearts in the new video.
Can't get enough of PEOPLE's Royals coverage? Sign up for our free Royals newsletter to get the latest updates on Kate Middleton, Meghan Markle and more! 
Meghan unveiled her As ever brand in March 2025 as a curated line of shelf-stable food products including jams, teas, and flower sprinkles, timed near the premiere of season one of her lifestyles show With Love, Meghan on Netflix.
The chocolate collab is As ever's latest venture and the Duchess of Sussex opened up to PEOPLE in 2025 about launching her brand and her hopes for it. 
"I see myself as an entrepreneur and a female founder, and if the brand ends up influential, then that’s great," she said.

title: Best Celebrity Red Carpet Style Photos: Updated Daily
description: The can't-miss red carpet looks on your favorite stars from the week's biggest events from Los Angeles to London.
content:
All the can't-miss looks on your favorite stars at this week's most major events all over the world
Stars are heating up red carpets all across the world.

In London, Charli XCX and Margot Robbie turned heads at the London premiere of Wuthering Heights. Meanwhile, in San Fransisco, Ciara stepped out for the 15th Annual NFL Honors.
Check out the photo gallery ahead for a look at every can't-miss outfit from the week. And for even more star style, see every major outfit of late here.
Charli XCX appeared at the London premiere of Wuthering Heights in a custom bridal-inspired Erdem gown. The baby pink ensemble featured a floral lace design, off-the-shoulder sleeves and a dramatic pale pink tulle veil.

At the London premiere of Wuthering Heights, Margot Robbie wowed in a custom Dilara Findikoglu gown and Boucheron Emily Brontë-inspired jewelry. The naked dress featured an off-white corset bodice cascading into a short sheer train. Olive green braids of real hair create an outer corset on the dress, draping down to cross at the knees, with hair flowers scattered throughout.

Christopher Polk/Variety via Getty
In San Fransisco, Ciara stepped out for the 15th Annual NFL Honors in a silver Valdrin Sahiti gown draped over a black lace corseted bodice.
In Universal City, Calif., Keke Palmer attended the premiere of The 'Burbs in a tan Gucci coat with a matching handbag, boots and head scarf.
In N.Y.C., Mary J. Blige appeared at the world premiere of Be Happy in a belted black jacket with fur accents on the shoulders and matching black trousers.
In London, Alexa Chung attended the DEBUTE Two of Hearts Valentine's dinner in a black mini slip dress with lace details.
Emerald Fennell appeared at the Wuthering Heights photocall in London in a black leather trench-style dress with a metallic belt by Burberry.
Margot Robbie appeared at the Wuthering Heights photo call in Paris in a black corseted column dress and jewelry by Jessica McCormack.
For the Apple TV Press Day in L.A., Kerry Washington wore a black leather midi dress that unzipped from the the waist down to reveal a coordinating leather skirt underneath. The actress also wore matching knee-high boots.
Eric Charbonneau/Apple TV via Getty
Jennifer Garner stepped out for the Apple TV Press Day in L.A. wearing a brown blouse with a bow at the collar and a black leather midi skirt.
In N.Y.C., Keke Palmer appeared on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon in a baby pink mini dress and matching fur shawl.
In L.A., Jennifer Hudson appeared at the 2026 MusiCares Person of the Year event in an embellished blue turtleneck gown and a voluminous blue patterned shawl.
Mariah Carey appeared at the 2026 MusiCares Person of the Year event in L.A. in a black sheer gown with a corseted bodice by Prada.
In L.A., Selena Gomez celebrated the launch of Rare Beauty at Ulta Beauty in a black satin blazer dress with a 3D floral detail at the waist. The star also wore black tights and pumps.
In London, Cynthia Erivo attended the 46th Critics' Circle Film Awards in a strapless brown dress with feather details at the hips and a short train.
At the 2026 MusiCares Person of the Year event in L.A., SZA stepped out in a billowing red gown with long sleeves and a sweetheart neckline.

title: Halle Berry Says Her Iconic Pixie Cut 'Defined' Her Career and Secured Her First Acting Role
description: Halle Berry is looking back at her iconic pixie cut — which she says will likely make a return to at some point in the future — and how it helped her land her first acting role.
content:
The actress added that she'll likely bring back the pixie at some point in the future
ABC Photo Archives/Disney General Entertainment Content via Getty; Jamie McCarthy/Getty 
Halle Berry is crediting her famous pixie cut for helping her snag her first major television role in the 1980s.
Berry, 59, spoke on the Fri., Feb. 6 episode of Vogue's The Run-Through podcast.
Speaking about the pixie cut she wore for decades in the 1980s, '90s and beyond, the actress said the hairstyle "defined my life and my career for a time."
"Cutting my hair into a pixie actually got me my first acting job, so I have a love affair with that pixie," Berry added, referencing her first acting gig as Emily Franklin on the 1980’s sitcom Living Dolls. "And I will go back to the pixie — when I'm ready to wear gray hair."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
ABC Photo Archives/Disney General Entertainment Content via Getty
The actress continued: "I will go back to a short pixie. I will do that. I'm not there yet, but one day, I will go back to my pixie when I want to wear gray hair."
"I want a gray pixie," she declared.

The actress has previously spoken about the iconic hairstyle, saying in a 2019 interview with InStyle, that it wasn’t until after she chopped off her long hair that she finally booked an acting gig.
“I think that was because the directors and producers actually saw me,” Berry said, while reflecting on past cover shoots for the fashion magazine’s 25th Anniversary Issue. “Before that, I had long hair like every other girl like me. When I got [that] haircut, I felt like my best self.”
Berry — who recently confirmed that she is engaged to musician Van Hunt — is a mom to two children: daughter Nahla Ariela Aubry, 17, whom she shares with ex-boyfriend Gabriel Aubry, and son Maceo-Robert Martinez, 12, whom she shares with ex-husband Olivier Martinez. She was first married to retired Major League Baseball player David Justice for four years in the 1990s, and then to singer/actor Eric Benét from 2001 to 2003. In 2013, Berry married French actor Martinez, now 60, but the couple split in 2015. Since 2020, Berry has been in a relationship with Hunt.
She will soon star in the film Crime 101, which hits theaters Feb. 13.

title: Anna Baryshnikov Says Idiotka Costar Julia Fox ‘Did Her Own Makeup’ and Helped ‘Curate’ Her Own Style on Set (Exclusive)
description: Anna Baryshnikov told PEOPLE that her 'Idiotka' costar Julia Fox was highly involved in the styling of her character in the irreverent comedy. "Every day she walked on set, she helped really curate what she was wearing," the actress shared.
content:
"The energy she brought to set was incredible," Baryshnikov told PEOPLE at the film's New York premiere
Julia Fox is once again proving herself to be a jack of all trades.
At the New York City premiere of her new film Idiotka on Thursday, Feb. 5, Fox's costar Anna Baryshnikov told PEOPLE that the Uncut Gems actress was highly involved in the styling of her character, Emma Wexler.
"She's incredible. Every day she walked on set, she helped really curate what she was wearing," said Baryshnikov, 33. "She did her own makeup. The energy she brought to set was incredible."
The actress added that Fox, 36, was " so supportive" of the movie's director, Nastasya Popov.
"I think it's a really big deal that she lends her talent and her name towards emerging artists of all kinds, emerging designers and emerging filmmakers," Baryshnikov continued. "I just think she's one of our best."
In the irreverent comedy, Baryshnikov plays Margarita, a disgraced fashion designer facing financial issues who enters a reality show with a six-figure cash prize to save her babushka’s West Hollywood apartment.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
"But as the competition intensifies, slick producer Nicol (Camila Mendes) pushes her to spin her family’s struggle into spectacle, forcing Margarita to decide whether to play along or take control of her own narrative, one unhinged look at a time," reads an official synopsis.

Fox plays one of the reality show's judges, alongside Benito Skinner and Saweetie.
In October, the Down the Drain author, who has made headlines for her daring style choices, opened up to The Sunday Times about a shopping spree during which she spent over $60,000 on designer items in one trip.
"I used my man’s credit card in a mania, spent $68,000 in a night and bought hundreds of Chanel, YSL, Pucci, Mugler, Christian Lacroix, Alexander McQueen and Versace pieces," Fox said when asked about the priciest thing she's ever purchased.

However, the actress and model ended up getting rid of the items once she was single again.
"I had to sell them all when he dumped me," she shared.

Although Fox, who now identifies as pansexual, didn't name her then-partner, she did briefly touch upon her quick marriage to pilot Peter Artemiev, with whom she shares son Valentino, 4, when asked about an outfit she'll "never forget."
"I got married in Vegas on a whim in 2018," she recalled. "I wore bedazzled Steve Madden shoes, which I’d bought the same day, and a white DaisyLtd sundress that I had in my luggage. He wore a red shirt with pin-up girls all over it and cowboy boots. It was perfect."

title: Chappell Roan's Makeup Artist Says She Used Gum Wrappers to Create Fake Nipple Piercings for Shocking 2026 Grammys Look
description: Chappell Roan's makeup artist Sasha Glasser gave 'Allure' the behind-the-scenes details on the singer's nearly-naked 2026 Grammys look. Glasser reveals that Roan's fake nipple rings were created with the help of silicone prosthetics, gum wrappers and mesh fabric.
content:
Special effects artist Sasha Glasser says that Roan's nearly-naked moment is "a testament to our skills that we’ve worked so long on perfecting"
John Shearer/Getty for The Recording Academy
Chappell Roan's makeup artist is pulling back the curtain on the singer's shocking topless look at the 2026 Grammy Awards.
In a new interview with Allure,  makeup and special effects artist Sasha Glasser revealed exactly how her team pulled off the jaw-dropping red carpet illusion, which involved fake nipple rings that attached to Roan's custom sheer Mugler gown.
"The idea was for her to not be so naked," Glasser told the outlet.
The process began with prosthetic nipple covers from the brand Out of Kit. “It’s not like any other type of prosthetic because it has a sticky backing, like a Band-Aid, so you don’t have to glue it down," the artist explained. To ensure the covers stayed put, Glasser and her team (makeup artists Malina Stearns and Chelsea Delfino) also used Telesis glue, an extra-strong medical-grade prosthetic adhesive.
However, once the nipple rings were placed in the prosthetic, it ripped at the slightest tug. "... That was scary," Glasser said. She decided to reinforce the nipple cover with power mesh, which worked like a charm.
"I cut a dime-size piece, glued it to the back of the prosthetic, and then we stuck the earring through both the prosthetic and the mesh,” she explained.
The final step was painting the prosthetic to perfectly match Roan's skin. Because this process had to be done while the nipple rings were already in place, Glasser kept the jewelry clean by covering them in bubblegum wrappers which she removed before clasping the dress.
Of the team's ingenuity, Glasser said, "It helps when you have good prosthetics, but it’s also a testament to our skills that we’ve worked so long on perfecting.”

The prosthetics also explain how Roan, 27, was able to skirt a fine from CBS, which airs the Grammys. Per The Sun, the networks' guidelines state that attendees should avoid "sheer, see-through clothing that could possibly expose female breast nipples.”

The Grammy winner arrived on the red carpet in a trompe l'oeil gown by Mugler consisting of a skin-tone bodice with faux nipple piercings and intricate tattoos. The custom creation, which draped sheer burgundy fabric from the faux piercings to the floor and featured a matching cape, was inspired by a runway design from Thierry Mugler’s spring 1998 "Jeu de Paume" couture collection.

Roan completed her Grammys look, curated by her longtime stylist Genesis Webb, with gold fine jewelry from Buccellati.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

After the "Good Luck, Babe!" singer's faux-naked look made headlines, Roan responded to the flurry of commentary.
"Giggling because I don’t even think this is THAT outrageous of an outfit," the singer shared on Instagram in a Monday, Feb. 2 carousel post with photos of her look.
"The look’s actually so awesome and weird," Roan continued, adding, "I recommend just exercising your free will it’s really fun and silly :D Thank you for having me @grammys and those who voted for me!!"

title: Dad Came Home After a Long Day and Got a Jury Duty Summons. Then He Realized It Was for His 4-Year-Old Daughter
description: No one is ever happy to get a jury summons in the mail, but that's especially true for one Connecticut dad when he realized the letter had his 4-year-old daughter's name on it.
content:
After her dad explained what jury duty even was, he tells PEOPLE that his daughter rightly replied: "How am I supposed to do that? I’m just a baby!”
Susan Young is a reporter. She started contributing to PEOPLE in 2008, covering entertainment, human interest, crime, health and breaking news stories.
No one is ever happy to get a jury summons in the mail, but that's especially true for one Connecticut dad when he realized the letter had his 4-year-old daughter's name on it.
Dr. Omar Ibrahimi tells PEOPLE that he came home on Monday, Feb. 1, after a long day, walked to the mailbox and started sorting through its contents. It was then he saw the letter from the state judicial department with the huge jury summons stamp.
“It’s never a good time to get one of those,” says Ibrahimi, a dermatologist specializing in laser surgery. “Then I saw the name on it was Zara.”
Ibrahimi texted his wife Sadia, 41, and told her the news — meanwhile, their preschooler, who heard the conversation, just wanted to know what exactly was going on.
Her dad decided to turn the situation into an impromptu little kid civics lesson.
Imbrahimi says he explained how you go into a room with 12 people who listen to something that happened and then decided if someone’s guilty or not guilty.
“She’s like, 'How am I supposed to do that? I’m just a baby!' ” Ibrahimi says. “She’s used that line to get out of stuff, but I think it was a pretty legitimate excuse this time.”
His wife tells PEOPLE they extended the lesson by asking Zara if her 12-year-old sister Sarah “was guilty or not guilty of sometimes being a bad sister.” Zara, she says, quickly proclaimed “Guilty!”

But then came the more difficult part: figuring out how to fix it.
He went to the website where prospective jurors are supposed to register and while there were a lot of forms, he says there were none that read: “We made a mistake, how do we excuse you?”
There was, however, a box asking for your highest level of education.
Obviously there was no preschool option so Ibrahimi opted for “Did not complete high school" — then found a box where he could state the situation even more plainly, writing a message on behalf of his daughter.
“I wrote 'I am 4 years old and am in preschool. This is obviously some sort of mistake,' " Ibrahimi recalls.
The family says they later received a notification from the judicial branch confirming the mistake and dismissing Zara from jury duty. 
Zara's parents tell PEOPLE that according to the jury administration's investigation, the error occurred because the revenue department, one of four sources used to generate jury lists, does not report age information.
Sadia Ibrahimi tells PEOPLE that her son Daniel, 8, is a little miffed about all the attention his little sister has been getting and wonders why he didn’t get a summons. 
As for big sister Sarah, she told her parents that if it had been her, she wouldn't have tried to get out of it.
“She said she would have shown up. She’s actually as tall as me and just looking at her, you might think she was old enough,” admits Sadia. 
However, her parents say that after this debacle, there's one thing they're convinced of more than ever: their household won't be able to escape jury duty for much longer.
“We brought so much attention to this," Sadia says, "the next notice will probably be for us.”

title: Man Lost His High School Class Ring When He Was Still a Teenager. It Was Found 44 Years Later, Buried in the Sand
description: A man has been reunited with his class ring 44 years after it was lost on a beach in Mississippi when he was a high school senior.
content:
“I was ecstatic,” said Darien Ladner, who lost the ring in 1982
A man has been reunited with his class ring 44 years after losing it on a beach in Mississippi as a high school senior.
"I was ecstatic, I couldn’t believe it," Darien Ladner, of Pass Christian told WLOX.
Ladner was visiting a local beach with friends in 1982 when the ring fell off his finger and into the sand, according to the outlet.
Although he and his pals quickly “started digging in the sand trying to find it,” that unintentionally caused the ring to sink deeper in the sand. 
An assistant principal from the school even tried to help find the ring with a metal detector, but the search was unsuccessful.
But the ring did not remain lost forever — 44 years later, Sammy Jewell found it while using a metal detector on the same beach during low tide.
The ring was located about a foot beneath the sand, according to WLOX.
So Jewell set out to find the ring’s owner and quickly made contact with Ladner, who found out the good news on the morning of Monday, Feb. 2.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Despite being buried for decades, the ring only has one small scuff, according to WLOX. Now, Ladner plans to pass it down to his kids.

title: Mom Welcomes Quintuplets Following High-Risk Pregnancy. They’re Still Hospitalized Nearly 2 Months Later: 'One Day at a Time'
description: In December 2025, Jessica and John Lottbrein welcomed quintuplets at a hospital in Buffalo, N.Y. Nearly two months later, the preemies have doubled their weight and are transitioning off oxygen, but remain hospitalized.
content:
The babies — three boys and two girls — were born late last year weighing about 2 lbs. each
A couple may have to buy a bus after welcoming quintuplets at a New York hospital last December, becoming a family of nine.
"It's surreal," Jessica Lottbrein told ABC affiliate WKBW of giving birth to five babies on Dec. 18 at the Golisano Children's Hospital of Buffalo. "It's so fun to watch them as individuals and then come together as all five."
Lottbrein and her husband, John Lottbrein, were already parents of two when they underwent fertility treatments so they could have a third child, according to a hospital press release. But during their first fetal scan, they learned they weren't just having one baby — they were actually expecting quintuplets. 
“At first, I was scared,” Jessica said, according to the organization. “You hear it, you start panicking, asking, ‘Can my body do it?’ ”
The “amazing mother” is a 911 dispatcher, and when her colleagues learned about her high-risk pregnancy, they organized a GoFundMe to help the growing family. 
Dawei David Wang, MD, a maternal-fetal medicine specialist at GCH Buffalo, informed the parents of the risks that Jessica faced while carrying quintuplets, according to the hospital.
“Pregnancies like this carry significantly increased risks, including preterm labor, hypertension, pre-eclampsia and diabetes,” he said. “There are also physical challenges from carrying five fetuses, including pressure on the cardiac and respiratory systems.”
Even as she navigated the possible complications, Jessica lived life as normally as possible as she awaited the arrival of her babies, including trick-or-treating with her girls and getting a Christmas tree, according to the hospital.
By Dec. 13, she was admitted to the Level IV NICU at GCH Buffalo, where teams had been preparing for the big day.
Jessica went into labor early, which her care team was able to stave off for a few days. Then her babies arrived.
“It was like a well-oiled machine,” Dr. Kavya Rao, a neonatologist at the hospital, told WKBW. “We had everyone that needed to be there from the second they were born, from the time they were stabilized, so each baby had about five team members.” 
In the early morning hours of Dec. 18, the five babies — Holly, Mason, Stefan, Connor and Layla — were born, each weighing about 2 lbs., according to the outlet.
Since the delivery, the babies have been growing in size, transitioning off oxygen and learning to bottle feed independently, according to the hospital. 
In an update on the donation page late last month, Jessica wrote that her son Mason had been sick with necrotizing enterocolitis, a potentially dangerous gastrointestinal problem, and had to be intubated  — but speaking with PEOPLE on Friday, Feb. 6, she says her son is on the mend.
"Mason is doing good," Jessica says. "He has had some minor setbacks, and they needed to up his oxygen support, but overall, he is a fighter and gets a little bit stronger every day."
His brother, Stefan, has had some setbacks as well, and has been preemptively treated for an infection as his medical team waits for lab work results. But his mom says that he appears to be making progress, and his brother, Connor, is doing well.
As for the girls, she says there's "been talk of Holly and Layla coming home as early as next week, but nothing is guaranteed."
"We are just taking everything one day at a time," she adds, sharing that when it comes to the boys, she imagines they still have several more weeks in the hospital to go.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
As for other women navigating high-risk pregnancies, Jessica shared a bit of advice.
“Keep your head up,” she said, according to the hospital. “Remain strong, mama. It’s hard, but it’ll be worth it.”

title: Nervous Proposal Goes Viral as Man Throws Up After Popping the Question (Exclusive)
description: After Braydon Dewey popped the question to Destiny Fajen, he threw up in a nearby bush. A video of the nervous proposal has gone viral on TikTok. 'I was just relieved that it all went perfectly and she said 'yes,' ' the groom-to-be tells PEOPLE.
content:
"To be honest, I was just relieved that it all went perfectly and she said 'yes,' " groom-to-be Braydon Dewey tells PEOPLE
A man's proposal took a turn as his nerves got the best of him.
Braydon Dewey, 22, proposed to Destiny Fajen, 22, last year on Aug. 24 at Halfmoon Town Park in Halfmoon, New York. Wanting it to be a "perfect surprise," Dewey invited Fajen's family to witness the special moment. However, he was so "nervous something would go wrong" that his perfect plan fell apart as he puked in a nearby bush in front of everyone immediately after popping the question.
"I was worried and slightly confused about what had just happened," Fajen recalls to PEOPLE.
She continues, "He actually whispered 'I'm sorry' right as he stood up to go throw up. I took a second to realize what was happening then went to go make sure he was okay."
The bride-to-be shared a clip and several photos from the unexpected moment on TikTok on Feb. 5, writing, "POV: Your fiancé was so nervous to propose to you that the second you said yes he went and threw up." The post went viral, amassing about 14 million views and over 3 million likes in just 24 hours.
In the video, Dewey is all smiles when he asks Fajen to marry him while on bended knee. After he helps her slide on her diamond engagement ring, his eyes widen with panic and his cheeks puff out as a wave of nausea hits him. He quickly presses a hand over his mouth before running over to a bush and vomiting.
Fajen's closest relatives — including her parents, sister, aunt, uncle, and grandparents — watched on as she rushed over to comfort her fiancé by bending down, hugging him, and rubbing his back. Despite the mishap, she wasn't any less excited and maintained a beaming smile.
"Honestly, everyone kinda pretended it didn't happen, trying to make him feel better about it," she tells PEOPLE.
Although the public puking might have been a little embarrassing, Dewey didn't let it ruin the moment.

"To be honest, I was just relieved that it all went perfectly and she said 'yes,' " he says.

Now, the mishap is just a funny memory.
"We have a photo of it framed in the house and get a good laugh out of it now," Fajen says.
Fajen recently commented on a photo of her soon-to-be husband under a TikTok video, and her comment went viral, inspiring her to make her TikTok post. She thinks it's "amazing" that it blew up so fast.
"The comments we are getting are hilarious," she adds.
One of the top comments jokes, "You think he might be pregnant?"
"Oh he said in sickness starts NOW," another user wrote.
Someone else teased, "Oh wedding day is gonna be a tough one for him😭."
Fajen and Dewey met in 2022. At the time, Fajen was a hostess at a restaurant. Dewey came in as a customer, and "the rest is history." They made their relationship official on Feb. 23, 2022.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
The couple will tie the knot under the Superstition Mountains in Arizona later this month on Feb. 23, their fourth anniversary.

title: Mom Barred from Bringing Medicine Into Stadium for Daughter with Rare Form of Dwarfism. Now She's Fighting Back (Exclusive)
description: Cierra Moore was barred from bringing her daughter's medicine into the stadium. Moore now tells PEOPLE why she'll always advocate for her daughter, who has a rare form of dwarfism, in an exclusive interview.
content:
Cierra Moore's daughter Lakelynn was diagnosed at birth with rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata type 1, which is a rare and terminal form of dwarfism
Cierra Moore didn't think she'd need to defend her daughter, who has a rare form of dwarfism, when they were trying to enjoy a basketball game together.
In a video shared to her TikTok, the Iowa-based mom of three shared her experience attending a basketball game, where she was questioned if her one-year-old daughter's wheelchair was actually a wheelchair and told she couldn't bring her medical supplies into the game.
Now Moore, whose daughter has rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata type 1 (RCDP), tells PEOPLE more about the situation and explains why she will always advocate for her daughter.
"My daughter Lakelynn was diagnosed at birth with RCDP, a rare and terminal form of dwarfism," she says. "There is less than 100 affected children in the entire world. Typical life expectancy is 1-6 years."
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.  
"It is characterized by intellectual disabilities, seizures, cataracts at birth, contractures [and] respiratory failure. And those are just a few of the many complications that come with this rare genetic disease," explains Moore. "We have an in-home nurse that provides nursing care while I am at work."
Moore says her daughter is G-tube dependent and eats every three hours. She gets physical therapy to stretch her muscles – Moore has to be very careful with her daughter's legs and arms, because moving them can cause severe pain.
"She has multiple doctor appointments a month, which I have to take time off work and drive almost two hours to her specialists," says the mom of three.
When she went to the basketball game earlier this month, Moore was surprised when she was immediately approached by a security officer who told her she couldn't bring her daughter's "stroller" into the venue.
"I explained that it was used as a wheelchair," says Moore. "She then stated that carseat strollers were not allowed."
Moore tried to explain her daughter's condition, but the security officer proceeded to tell her she also couldn't bring in her fanny pack, which she was using for her daughter's medical purposes.
"My mom explained to her why I need the fanny pack (it had urgent G-tube supplies in there) and I needed it in a ready accessible bag that was always attached to me," she says. "If my daughter was to pull her G-tube out, I want to make sure I have her emergency tube that I can place in a quick manner so her hole does not close up. Then she told my mom that it needed to be in a clear bag."
But the security officer still wouldn't listen to her. Moore and her mom decided it wasn't worth it and went to leave the venue. Moore took the elevator down with her daughter and was approached by another security officer, who again told her that her daughter's wheelchair wasn't allowed in the venue.
"I then told her that she was a dwarf and they don't just have wheelchairs in her size readily available," says Moore. "I broke down in tears, and everyone waiting to get their tickets scanned witnessed this interaction. It really made me feel like my daughter didn't belong there. I truly feel like we were harassed by the staff and security personnel."
Now, Moore says that her end goal is to make these establishments understand that parents who have kids with special needs require special equipment, such as wheelchairs and medical devices.
"We should not have to explain in detail why children need certain medical equipment, etc.," says Moore. "No special needs parent should fear being rejected, and that is the point I'm going to make — raising awareness for special needs parents who need special accommodations and should never be questioned."
To help support Moore and her daughter Lakelynn, please visit their GoFundMe here. You can learn more about Lakelynn's journey from her Facebook page.

title: PEOPLE Picks Our 10 Favorite Romance Books for Valentine's Day
description: Our staff loves love stories, whether in an enduring classic, steamy new romance novels or a heart-racing memoir. Here are our favorites
content:
If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.
Our staff loves love stories, whether in an enduring classic, steamy new romance novels or a heart-racing memoir. Here are our top picks
Love is in the air this Valentine's Day! If you need a book or two (or four, or five) to keep you warm this love week, PEOPLE has you covered. We polled our staff on their favorite books featuring love stories and came up with two handfuls of steamy romance novels, classic love stories that stand the test of time and even a memoir that has our hearts racing right through the very last page.
Whether you prefer your romance hot and sexy, slow-burn and swoony or ripped from the real-life headlines, there's sure to be something that suits your taste on our list.
Love spending time at The Cottage from Heated Rivalry? Pack your (mental) bags to head off to the lakeside town of Barry’s Bay, Canada with Alice. When she was 17, she spent the summer at her Nan’s cottage by the lake, where she snapped an iconic photograph of three teenagers that changed the course of her life. Now she's back and, well, you'll just have to read to find out what happens next.

As the staffer who recommended this classic put it: "It's time to haunt ourselves." If you've never read the 1847 book that basically invented dark romance, or if it's been awhile, pick it up before you watch the new film adaptation starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi.
Fans of Ali Hazelwood won't want to sleep on this enemies-to-lovers fantasy academia rom-com. Rival grad student wizards are forced to work together and have to figure out how to collab without killing — or falling for — the other.

This Moulin Rouge-coded romance between a vaudeville star and a showbiz tycoon is the perfect historical swoon for anyone who longs to see their name in lights. Get ready for your close-up, dahling.
When Elsie finds out her fiancé planned their wedding and honeymoon as a surprise — and it's only a week away, she breaks things off and boards a plane for the Caribbean with her bestie Ginny instead. Oh, and Ginny has carried a torch for Elsie for over a decade. If you can't have fun in the sun yourself, let this one warm you up from the inside.

You've Got Mail fans won't want to miss this chaotic bisexual romance in which a podcaster and her producer fall in love via email without realizing who they're really emailing. Forced proximity, workplace romance, enemies-to-lovers, hidden identity — the trope gang's all here.

When a late-bloomer decides to visit a sex club, she vibes with a sexy stranger. The next morning, Stella is shocked to find out the media website where she works is partnering with an AI company — and the hot guy from the night before turns out to be the creator of the AI program now threatening her job. This thoroughly modern romance totally lives up to its name.

Nora Ephron fans, this one is for you. This cozy romance follows Ari and Josh, who first meet when they're both sleeping with the same woman. The total opposites quickly decide they hate each other, before reconnecting several years later and becoming friends — and that's just how it starts.
The staffer who recommended this true story of a married couple who get shipwrecked called this one "very good and very,  very steamy — but in more of a heat stroke, dehydration and intense sunburn kinda way." Need we say more?
Look, we're only human. Several PEOPLE staffers are still riding the Heated Rivalry wave, catching up on Rachel Reid's sexy, steamy hockey romance series. It's available for immediate check-out at the New York Public Library — just another reason why we love libraries.

title: Over 6,000 Cases of Repackaged M&M's Recalled for Undeclared Allergens Across 20 States
description: The repackaged candies were used as promotional materials for universities, companies and organizations
content:
The repackaged candies were used as promotional materials for universities, companies and organizations
Chocolate lovers are advised to check the packaging on certain bags of M&M's they might have lying around.
On Jan. 26, Beacon Promotions Inc. initiated a voluntary recall of over 6,000 cases of several repackaged M&M products with promotional names and branding on them for containing undeclared allergens including milk, peanut and soy.
The FDA classified the recall as Class II on Feb. 4, which means that consuming the products can “cause temporary or medically reversible adverse health consequences” to those with applicable allergies.
Affected products include 1.3-Ounce Repackaged M&M's Peanut candies labeled as “Make Your Mark” as well as 1.3-Ounce Repackaged M&M's Peanut candies labeled with dozens of company names, including Morgan Stanley, Adobe, xfinity, Subaru and more.
For a full list of affected packaging, including lot numbers and sell-by dates, consumers are urged to visit the FDA's website.
The candies were distributed across 20 U.S. states — Alabama, Arizona, California, Florida, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Minnesota, North Carolina, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington and Wisconsin.
No illnesses have been reported as a result of the recall as of the time of publishing.

title: Outbreak from Drinking Raw Milk Leaves 9 Hospitalized, Including 2 Children
description: An Idaho outbreak from drinking non-pasteurized milk has left 9 people hospitalized, including two children. They were sickened with "one of the most potent bacterial toxins known.” The outbreak comes days after a New Mexico newborn's death was linked to the mother drinking raw milk while pregnant.
content:
Days after a New Mexico newborn's death was linked to the mother drinking raw milk while pregnant, health officials say 9 people were sickened in Idaho from non-pasteurized milk
Richard Lautens/Toronto Star via Getty 
Nine people — including two children — have been hospitalized in Idaho’s Ada County with complications of E. coli infections after drinking raw milk, health officials say.
Health officials said laboratory testing confirmed the presence of Shiga toxin-producing Escherichia coli, or (STEC). It’s “one of the most potent bacterial toxins known,” the National Library of Medicine says.
The toxin can cause “cause severe foodborne illness, including bloody diarrhea and vomiting, and may lead to serious complications, particularly in children, older adults, and people with weakened immune systems,” Central District Health officials said in a press release announcing the outbreak.
“Two children are hospitalized with hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS), a rare but serious complication of E. coli infection that can lead to kidney failure and long-term health problems. One case has laboratory-confirmed STEC infection; the second is epidemiologically linked based on reported consumption of the same brand of raw milk as other confirmed cases,” the officials say.
All of those sickened reported drinking raw milk from R Bar H, health officials say. PEOPLE has reached out to R Bar H for further information. Officials say the milk producer has pulled their products from shelves and suspended production while the investigation into the source of the contamination is underway.
It’s part of an ongoing uptick in illnesses linked to raw milk in Idaho. In November, the state reported that 26 people — including 6 children under the age of 12 —  had been sickened after drinking raw milk. Officials noted that “In Idaho, raw milk can be sold legally through multiple outlets, but it is not required to be tested for bacteria such as Campylobacter, E. coli or other disease-causing agents.”
The latest outbreak comes on the heels of news that a New Mexico newborn died of listeria, contracted after the infant’s mother drank raw milk while pregnant. 
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control advises people to drink milk that has been pasteurized — a process that “removes disease-causing germs by heating milk to a high enough temperature for a certain length of time.” 
“Pasteurized milk offers the same nutritional benefits without the risks of raw milk consumption,” the CDC says, adding that “good practices on farms can reduce contamination, they cannot guarantee safety from harmful germs.”

title: Sabrina Carpenter Builds the Perfect Man Out of Pringles in Her First Ever Super Bowl Ad
description: The pop star builds her dream man, Pringleleo, out of chips in Pringles' Super Bowl 2026 commercial
content:
The pop star made her Super Bowl commercial debut in a hilarious new ad for Pringles.
Sabrina Carpenter has found true love, but there's a catch.
In a new Super Bowl 2026 ad for Pringles, the "Espresso" singer, fed up with real men, builds a boyfriend for herself, chip-by-chip. His name? Pringleleo.
The ad sees Carpenter and Pringleleo in a series of sweet vignettes. The pair go on a romantic date, ride with the top down, and spend time together in bed. But things go south when Pringleleo is tackled and destroyed by rabid fans, who eat the chips that once made up his body. In the end, the salty snacks are impossible to resist, and even Carpenter takes a bite of Pringleleo.
PEOPLE was the first to reveal that Carpenter would be appearing in her first-ever Super Bowl ad. In a trailer for the ad, Carpenter can be seen picking Pringles from a "bouquet" like flowers.
Carpenter may have manifested the collaboration years ago. In 2017, a 17-year-old Sabrina tweeted: "Is there a way to look attractive while eating Pringles asking for a friend."
The ad is part of Pringles' ongoing Once You Pop, The Pop Don't Stop campaign, which leans into the irresistibility of the classic potato chips that you can never have just one of.
Pringles is no stranger to featuring big stars in its Super Bowl ads. Last year, Pringles recruited Adam Brody, Nick Offerman, James Harden and Andy Reid for its Super Bowl 2025 commercial. The spot paid tribute to brand mascot Mr. P’s iconic handlebar mustache, as did its 2024 advertisement with Chris Pratt. Back in 2023, Pringles recruited another pop singer for its Super Bowl spot: Meghan Trainor.

title: Clinic Ordered to Pay $63,000 to Woman Who Claims Her Skin Was 'Damaged' from Laser Treatment
description: A clinic in Dublin, Ireland, was ordered to pay $63,000 to a 41-year-old woman who claimed a laser treatment damaged her skin. “If I go out in bright or sunny days my face would now come out in red blotches all over,” the woman claimed.
content:
“If I go out in bright or sunny days my face would now come out in red blotches all over,” the 41-year-old woman claimed
A clinic in Dublin, Ireland, was ordered to pay $63,000 to a 41-year-old woman who claimed a laser treatment left her with damaged skin.
According to the Irish Times, 41-year-old graphic designer Hui Hao told Judge Roderick Maguire in the Circuit Civil Court on Wednesday. Jan. 28, that she had severe reactions to the elements since undergoing a laser treatment from Dundrum Cosmetic Clinic in Dublin.
“If I go out in bright or sunny days my face would now come out in red blotches all over,” she said in her €60,000 negligence claim against the clinic, per the Irish Times.
Hao told her lawyer, Deirdre Byrne, that from March to October, she has to use significant medical and cosmetic protection to go out and often has to stay inside on sunny days.
Hao claims that she visited the clinic in September 2021 to address mild pigmentation under her left eye. “From the moment the doctor applied the laser to my cheek I was in pain and I complained about it but he didn’t stop and continued until the end,” she told Judge Maguire, per the Irish Times.
Byrne told the court that since Hao had issued her legal proceedings in May 2023, the defendant clinic had ignored the claim and judgment had already been obtained against them for failure to enter an appearance to the claim.

Judge Maguire said that Hao had been offered two or three laser treatments but had only undergone one. She was told that pain after the treatment was normal and would resolve in a day. When it didn't, Hao returned and was given an unlabeled bottle of cream.
“Pigmentation had broken out around her face and close to her lips and the cream she was given had no effect,” the judge said.
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
He added, “She has been disfigured after having the treatment."
Judge Maguire awarded Hao €46,496 ($63,053 USD) and costs.
One of Hao's lawyers, Stuart Gilhooly, tells PEOPLE that the company that owns Dundrum Cosmetic Clinic has "never responded to any correspondence and were not represented in court."

"It would be normal to hear from an insurance company," Gilhooly said via email. " ... This is unacceptable from a large service provider and one that purports to provide a premium service for treatments that are of immense importance to women."
PEOPLE reached out to Dundrum Cosmetic Clinic but has not heard back.

title: Bachelor Mansion Takeover Trailer Reveals High-Stakes and Heated Drama Between Former Castmates (Exclusive)
description: PEOPLE got an exclusive first look at the trailer for the upcoming HGTV series, 'Bachelor Mansion Takeover,' which follows 12 bachelor nation alumni as they compete to transform the beloved mansion.
content:
PEOPLE got an exclusive first look at the trailer for the upcoming HGTV series, which follows 12 bachelor nation alumni as they compete to transform the infamous mansion
Bachelor Nation fans can count on a fresh dose of drama to be served in HGTV's Bachelor Mansion Takeover!
PEOPLE can exclusively share the first trailer for the upcoming renovation competition series premiering Monday, March 2. The new show will follow 12 former Bachelor franchise contestants as they compete against each other to transform the iconic California home that fans know and love from the shows. 
In the above clip, host Jesse Palmer welcomes viewers to the “most dramatic renovation competition this mansion has ever seen.” As various interior shots of the property pan onto the screen, a voice in the background says, “Oh my god, if these walls could talk, they’d scream.”
Standing outside the home, Palmer announces: “For almost 20 years, this mansion has been the stage for roses and rejections. It’s where fairytales began, and where hearts were broken.”
After various old scenes from the franchise’s many seasons are shown, Palmer adds, “But now this legendary house is about to get a transformation of its own.”
A scene of the former contestants scoping out the familiar property then pans onto the screen as Golden Bachelorette alum Joan Vassos exclaims, “This looks so different!”
Palmer continues, “We brought together 12 Bachelor Nation alumni with real design and build expertise to give this place the makeover it deserves.” 
“They’ll build,” he says as shots of contestants getting their hands dirty while drilling and hammering are shown. 
“They’ll be judged,” he notes, as viewers catch a glimpse of some of the exciting guest judges, including HGTV stars Christina Haack and Nate Berkus, actress Rachel Bilson, and Bachelor alums JoJo Fletcher and Sean Lowe.
The series’ regular judges, Tayshia Adams and Tyler Cameron, also come down hard on each contestant, with Adams shaking her head in one scene and noting, “I don’t like it,” followed by Cameron adding, “I will say I don’t love the tile.”
“They’ll compete,” Palmer continues. “And in the end, only one will be crowned the winner, and walk away with a $100,000 cash prize.”
The trailer even reveals a few of the heated encounters viewers can expect to see, with Jill Chin yelling in one scene, “I hate your ideas and I always have!”
“I can’t let feelings get in the way of good design, ” adds Allyshia Gupta.
Palmer concludes dramatically, “The tools are real. The drama is real. And the stakes have never been higher.”
Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
In addition to Chin, Vassos and Gupta, the other Bachelor, Bachelorette, Bachelor in Paradise, and Golden Bachelor franchise alumni returning to the mansion include Dean Bell, Noah Erb, Tammy Ly, Sandra Mason, Sam McKinney, Brendan Morais, Courtney Robertson Preciado, Jeremy Simon and Christopher Stallworth.
Throughout the six-episode season, the former contestants will compete to transform multiple spaces in the beloved mansion, including the bunk rooms, the rose room, the pool area, the mixer room, the terrace and the kitchen. Each week, design and renovation skills will be tested, and contestants will be eliminated after each project.
Bachelor Mansion Takeover premieres on Monday, March 2, at 8 p.m. ET on HGTV. Each new episode will be available to stream the next day on HBO Max and discovery+ .

title: 12 Outstanding, History-Making Black Winter Olympians
description: Erin Jackson made history at the Beijing Games as the first Black woman to win a solo medal in speedskating! From being the first Black woman to earn a medal at the Winter Games to being the first to represent their countries, these exceptional Black athletes have made Winter Olympics history
content:
From being the first Black woman to earn a medal at the Winter Games to being the first to represent their countries, these exceptional Black athletes have made Winter Olympics history 
The 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, China, begin on Feb. 3, which means that they coincide with Black History Month. Here, we're celebrating the accomplishments of the trailblazing, outstanding Black athletes who have made history at the Winter Olympics over the years.
In 1988, Thomas won the bronze medal in figure skating and became the first Black athlete to medal at the Winter Games — all while she was still a student at Stanford University. She remains the only African American woman to win a medal in figure skating.
Flowers, representing Team USA in the two-women blobsleigh, won gold at the 2002 Winter Olympics, which made her the first Black athlete to win Winter Olympics gold. Pictured, she gets emotional while accepting her medal alongside teammate Jill Bakken.
In 2002, Iginla, representing Team Canada, became the second Black athlete to win gold at the Winter Olympics, taking his home as part of Canada's ice hockey team.
In 2006, while competing at the Winter Olympics in Turin, U.S. speed skater Davis became the first Black athlete to win gold in an individual competition.
Meyers Taylor (right) became the first U.S. athlete, male or female, to medal as both a brakeman and driver in bobsled after winning bronze at the 2010 Winter Games and silver at the 2014 Winter Games. She also has a silver medal from the PyeongChang Games in 2018.
In 2022, the Olympian made history again, winning silver in the first ever women's monobob event.
Williams (right) was the first woman to win summer and winter Olympics medals. As a sprinter, she won gold in the 4x100m at the London 2012 Games and silver in the 100m at the Athens 2004 Games.
In 2014, she competed at the Sochi Olympics and won silver in the two-woman bobsled. Her teammate was none other than fellow trailblazer, Elana Meyers Taylor (left).
Jackson was the first Black woman to be on the U.S. long-track speed skating team, qualifying for the 2018 Winter Olympics after learning to speed skate just four months prior.
Jackson, who is the world's top-ranked woman in the 500m event for speed skating, came in 3rd place at the recent U.S. Olympic trials in Milwaukee, nearly missing the opportunity to go to Beijing. Her teammate, Brittany Bowe, gave up her qualifying spot to ensure Jackson could compete.
While competing at the 2022 Winter Olympics, Jackson made history yet again when she became the first Black woman to win a solo medal in speed skating after coming out victorious in the 500m event.
She is also the first U.S. woman to win gold in speed skating at the Olympics in nearly 30 years, after Bonnie Blair placed first in 1994.
Greenway was the first African American player to compete for the United States in Olympic ice hockey when he played at the 2018 Games in Pyeongchang.
In 2018, Adeagbo made history as a member of Nigeria's first Winter Olympics team, and became the first Nigerian and African woman to compete in skeleton.
In 2018, Frimpong was Ghana's second athlete to ever compete in the Winter Olympics and the first to represent Ghana in skeleton.
Simander made history in 2018 when she competed at the Winter Games for Team Kenya — she was the only athlete representing the country that year — and became the first from her country to compete in Alpine skiing.
Biney, originally from Ghana, became the youngest skater and first Black woman to make a U.S. Olympic short track speed skating team and the second-ever African-born athlete to represent the United States in the Winter Olympics in 2018.
